story:
A Little About Me


My name is Courtney Cook, and I'm a high schooler from Chicago, IL. I'm a poet, artist, cacti-lover, and Harry Potter fanatic. Around this time last year I stumbled across a feminist blog on tumblr, and was instantly enamored. I felt like my eyes had been opened to an entire world I never knew existed. Since that time I have been in a constant whirlwind of researching any prevalent feminist political issues, reading feminist literature to teach myself, and participating in any feminist cause I can. Becoming an active feminist has allowed me to become more politically and socially aware, as well as allowed me to give back to my community by educating myself and those around me. Because of this new found passion, I would love to go to Feminist Camp!

 

What is Feminism?

I'm glad you asked! Feminism is the social justice movement concerning the equality of both sexes. Contrary to it's name, as many people believe, feminism is about women and men being equal, not about raising women above men. The feminist movement rallies for equal pay, work opportunity, safety, sexual freedom, and so much more. In short, feminism wants to eliminate things such as double standards, the wage gap, and rape culture!

 

What is Feminist Camp?

Feminist Camp is a camp hosted anually in New York City for rising feminists and those interested in feminist causes. Over the course of a week, peers will come together to attend workshops from feminist organizations and companies such as Bust Magazine, UNICEF, Girls Write Now, Planned Parenthood, and others in order to turn feminist theory into practice. Each day is themed, such as Reproductive Justice, Sexual Power, Feminist Art, and Philanthropy, as to give a rounded view of some of the many aspects of feminism. At the end of the week, a career day is held to show what careers help out the feminist cause. 

 

What I need

I am asking for 750 dollars, or half of the total cost to attend camp. These funds will go towards housing, breakfast and most lunches for the week, all programming, and a weekly Metro Card. Additionally, I will be using the money for the lunches and dinners that are not included in the original price to attend camp. If I do not reach my full goal, all funds raised will be used to help me get there any ways. 

 

The Impact

I do not think I can stress enough how pivotal camp would be for me. Most, if not all, of my knowledge on Feminism has stemmed from my own research, and I am dying to be given the opportunity to learn more. I am so enthusiastic about hearing those in the professional feminist world speak about their experiences and gain a further knowledge on the causes they are rooting for. I am looking to go into Feminism and Gender Studies in college, and I think this experience will absolutely solidify that for me. The impact it will have on my heart will be great as well, because I know being surrounded by people who share the same interests with the same fervor as I will provide me with friends for a life time. I believe I can bring all I learn from Feminist Camp back to my home town and share my knowledge in my school, with my friends, and in my workplace, in order to educate those who haven't even heard of Feminism, or even think it's dead! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you aren't able to contribute doesn't mean you aren't able to help! Tell a friend, neighbor, or loved one, or spread the word about this campaign on your blog or Facebook! I would love to get the word out there about not only Feminist Camp, but feminism in general! I would appreciate it so greatly.

story:
Dean is a young homeless man.. He is 25 years old.  He's a sufferer of cerebral palsy. He cannot do things like make food or drinks for himself therefore he needs a lot of help. He has been living on the streets on and off for over 5 years. He has been in foster care since he was 2, and at then from the age of 16 he has struggled to settle into the right care home for himself as despite his physical disability and emotional struggles he would like to live as independently as possible. Please watch the video to find out a little bit more about Dean!

Thankfully Dean's accommodation is now being funded! But Dean has asked if we would be able to stay in the same building if possible and we are entirely out of funding to be able to do this, travel to important meetings, for food let alone what is most important in Dean's mind, activities! As Dean's mind wanders so much it is so important to keep him occupied otherwise he gets low very quickly and easily and feels like returning to his 'hiding places' to sleep out on the street. He has been off the street since the 17th of January 2015 and has not slept out once thankfully.

We are now in the final stages of being able to get Dean housed appropriately! He has some spots to view over the coming weeks. However contact with social services always triggers Dean to become exceptionally distressed and usually ends up with a trip to A+E with his low feelings. Obviously we would like to end that trend by having a fun activity to do after contact with social services, such as bowling, swimming etc. Just to be able to take Dean's mind to a better place. 

Please note we can only access paypal donations immediately through IndieGoGo

story:
The Adoptee Rights Coalition is an adoptee-led organization of adult adoptees, original families, and adoptive families that supports legislation that will give all adopted adults unconditional restored access to their own original birth certificates.

The archaic laws that seal the original birth certificates of adopted people are the legacy of a culture of shame that stigmatized infertility, out-of-wedlock birth, and adoption. These laws send a negative message about being adopted. We protest to change these laws and challenge that message. 

Your Rights, Your Protest

Add your voice and help BUY THE BOOTH now!  

What we need:  

Each year, our organization attends the National Conference of State Legislators Annual Summit to raise awareness.  We demonstrate outside of the event as well as educate legislators at our booth inside of the event.  

This will be the 6th year that we have had an exhibit booth in the main exhibit hall during the conference. We are vying for attention against the huge lobby groups who have giant displays, custom swag to give away, and are funded by major interest groups. You can help our small grassroots campaign by giving what you can to help us get noticed.

Please help us buy the booth!

Through our generous supporters last year, we were able to fund our booth and we were able to buy updated supplies. We were able to secure our booth this year, but we still need funds for our booth supplies, sign making materials, and insurance for the demonstration. If you cannot make it to the demonstration this year, please consider a generous donation to help us create the best demonstration and booth possible.

Learn more:

Learn more about Adoptee Rights at our website www.adopteerightscoalition.com.

Thanks to your generous financial support last year, we were able to make an incredible difference in the lives of adopted people in the U.S. Legislators that came to our booth remembered us, and are learning about equal access legislation for their state. It is vital that we continue this work as states increasingly introduce excellent bills.

story:
By analyzing the samples collected in a rape kit, forensic scientists can develop a DNA profile that is unique to the perpetrator. That DNA profile can then be compared to a database with thousands of other DNA profiles from known offenders and from unsolved crime scenes. This process can both identify an unknown perpetrator and link a suspect to other crimes. 

To accomplish these things, however, rape kits must be tested. Because research suggests that rapists often commit more than one violent sexual assault and multiple violent crimes; it is important to also test DNA samples of prisoners who are already incarcerated for violent crimes. There is a huge backlog of processing these prisoner sample kits as well. 

In the United States, it is estimated that there are hundreds of thousands of untested kits in police and crime lab storage facilities. Each kit represents a survivor who courageously submitted to the four to six-hour rape kit collection process and reported the rape to the police. Many of these survivors never receive any follow-up information after filing the police report. 

Our Story

We assembled a team of committed scientists and technicians who will deliver results on time within a fraction of the cost of government labs and in accordance with FBI Laboratory’s guidelines, by using the latest technology to produce more accurate results. New equipment from Thermo Fischer can process multiplex samples and this has been generously offered to us at reduced cost. Thermo Fischer also offered to waive validation services, tech support services, and fees specifically for this project. Their machine is uniquely designed for rapid Human ID protocol. In addition to this partnership, we forged an alliance with lab robot startup Opentron. Using high throughput protocol provided by Opentron’s liquid handling robot, we will greatly reduce handling time, labor costs, and produce more accurate results (up to ~390 tests / hour). After the DNA is fingerprinted, we will sequence our genetic data and provide results to Law Enforcement through encrypted blockchain DNA file sharing provided by our partner Encrypgen.

The Phases of Impact

CerTek Bio will utilize state of the art automation to help reduce backlogs of rape kits in the US. As we grow, we will then tackle many other areas of DNA testing that is backlogged. 

Out process can also be used to help end the backlog of CODIS, (Combined DNA Index System) the generic term used to describe the FBI's program of support for criminal justice DNA databases. According to this PBS article, (http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/next/body/dna-data... ), “The only thing that’s limiting the expansion of DNA databases is the fact that samples often come in faster than labs can analyze them. That’s produced enormous backlogs. To address the problem, the federal government has given $151 million annually to state and local governments since 2005 to process DNA samples. That assistance has been extended through 2014. But even that funding hasn’t let labs catch up.”

We can process these violent prisoner DNA sample kits and offer objective DNA retesting as part of the Innocence Project. We hope to ultimately offer our services at cost to process global samples. Globally there are an excess of 87,000 rape cases per year. As we go further, we will offer our DNA forensics testing service to the Innocence Project (https://www.innocenceproject.org/). The Innocence Project, founded in 1992 by Peter Neufeld and Barry Scheck at Cardozo School of Law, exonerates the wrongly convicted through DNA testing and reforms the criminal justice system to prevent future injustice

 

What We Need

We need $800,000 in seed funding to: 

  • acquire equipment (for more information on the equipment, please check out 
  • Pay the technicians
  • Obtain ANAB Certification, achieve SWGDAM standard and ISO/IEC Certification.

 

 

What You Get!

  • We have lovely perks! 
  • The joy of giving the gift of help!
  • If we don't reach our  goal the funds will go towards www.Endthebacklog.com

Risks & Challenges

Some of the kits are not high quality DNA samples. Over time the kits may have degraded below detection, or there could have been issues with collecting the samples themselves. There will be times when our processing is not going to work, due to this poor quality. There could be times when the DNA we successfully process is not found in the DNA database. Innovations from ThermoFisher will allow us to perform simultaneous automated pre-screening of 96 samples at a time to determine if the sample contains Male DNA in significant enough quantities to perform analysis. Another challenge is DNA samples containing more than one contributor.

These challenges are not an excuse from processing backlog kits at all.  With our scientists and CSI experts, the processing of viable kits can happen at a much faster rate by identifying select high quality samples to perform full analysis on. These high quality samples are much more likely to achieve successful database matching and convection rate in court.

Ways You Can Help

  • Donate!
  • Get the word out and make some noise! Use the Indiegogo share tools, blast your social media. The more the campaign is shared, the more people we can reach- and reach our goals, so please - share, share, share.

story:
In the summer of 2012, I had the opportunity to visit Bethlehem, in the West Bank of Palestine, working at a children's summer program at Aida Refugee Camp. While I had many great experiences working and traveling in Bethlehem, and around the West Bank, I was by far the most interested and concerned by what I saw happening in the villages of rural Palestine. 'Area C'  compromises 61% of the land in the West Bank, but only 6% of the population, and is governed completely by the Israeli Military. The small agricultural communities in the area are constantly pressured to abandon their homes by both the Israeli Defense force and by Israeli Settlers. Villagers face housing demolitions, land confiscation, random arrests, flying checkpoints and other movement restrictions, and assault. The International Women's Peace Service works in Deir Istiya, one of the villages that has faced all of these difficulties, due to its proximity to the Ariel Settlement Block. The IWPS seeks to address these abuses by accompanying farmers working in dangerous areas, supporting nonviolent protests, documenting human rights violations, and intervening in critical situations.

The IWPS is entirely volunteer operated and runs on private donations. The money raised here would partially consist of a donation to the IWPS, and partially go to cover transportation expenses. 

If you donate $1, you automatically will be added to my update email list! Not only to you get to hear whats up with me, but you will get first hand, uncensored news about whats really happening in the West Bank.

If you donate $25, I'll send you a postcard. Since all Palestinian mail is held and censored by the Israeli Defense Forces, it make take over year to arrive in the United States. So basically in a year from now, when you've completely forgotten about it, you'll get a postcard from Palestine! What a pleasant surprise!

If you send fifty dollars or more, on return to the US, I will bring you a  Keffiyah, allowing you to show your support for Palestinian independence in genuine style!

 With the US continuing to overwhelmingly support Israel, international gestures of support for Palestinian rights and independence are few and far between. Because of this, it the task falls to international activists and independent peace-builders to build relationships between Americans, and Palestinians. By contributing, you are becoming a part of this relationship. By receiving updates, you can become better informed on the current events in Israel and Palestine, and the US's oppressive policies there. A penny a prayer and an act of goodwill can change the world!

story:
Short Summary

Basmeh and Zeitooneh started as a group of volunteers dedicated to serving Syrian refugees in Lebanon.  Soon afterwards, the group transformed into a registered non-governmental organization, whose primary goal is to motivate Syrian youth and women that are victimized by the conflict.

Basmeh and Zeitooneh’s role has been to find and initiate avenues for those affected by the conflict to develop their skills, and lead a life of dignity. Basmeh and Zeitooneh has established three community centers in Lebanon's most densely populated refugee camps (Shatila, Burj Al Barajneh and Bar Elias).

What We Need & What You Get

Basmeh and Zeitooneh's Women's Workshop aims to empower women that currently provide financial support to their families, and to help restore their sense of dignity which many have missed since their arrival to Lebanon. The workshop involves training in embroidery and in crochet, and subsequently allows the women an opportunity to sell their production,  thus facilitating their access to an income.

This campaign will ensure that the Workshop continues for an additional 6 months until it reaches self-sustainability. Basmeh and Zeitooneh aspires to continue offering a space for the women to be creative, productive and to feel empowered. The money will keep 90 women from going back to a life they chose to leave, and will enable more women from the camp to join our project, and lead a life of dignity.

Your donations to the campaign will be utilized to achieve the self-sustainability of the workshop. In order to achieve self-sustainability, Basmeh and Zeitooneh will utilize your funds to:

1- Expand the number of participants in the Women’s Workshop, and buy the materials necessary for the participants to produce their products.

2-Design and Implement a branding and a marketing strategy to sell the products all over the world.

3- Design and launch a website for the organization, and launch an E-shop to allow customers from all over the world to place customized orders and support our workshop.


What You Get:

As an organization, we  value your donations and acknowledge that you are playing a pivotal role in the lives of Syrian female refugees. With your donations, we will be launching a website that we will use to sell the products of the women’s workshop and to keep our cherished supporters up-to- date with all the activities of the organization.

In the meantime, in order to keep our supporters involved, the organization will be developing a newsletter which will be circulated by email. We also hope that you will follow our facebook page, where you can access information about our daily activities.

The Impact

Within one year, the participants in the workshop have expanded exponentially from entailing 10 participants to a total of 90 employees. The women were all housewives back in Syria, whose sole concern in life was caring for their children and their household. Today, however, they are active members of the community who support themselves and their families. Their access to an income has dramatically improved both their confidence and their decision-making powers within the household. It also gives these Syrian women a future, as the skills they are learning can be applied anywhere, which will enable them to continue working when they return to Syria. Furthermore, Syrian women are not solely reliant on humanitarian aid anymore, as they are able to earn their own money. When 90 more people can be employed by Basmeh & Zeitooneh that means 90 more families are being able to become self sustainable and not relying on aid. The whole project will become self sustainable because of the profits being made by selling the products.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can always be part of positive change, even if you can’t contribute financially but you can do a lot by:

1-Be an active part of the change and donate.

2-Find and follow us on our Social media channels, we go by the handler (@basmehzeitooneh).

3-Invite and encourage your  friends to follow  our Social Media Channels.

4- Generate buzz by Inviting your friends to share the campaign .

5- Don’t forget to use Indiegogo’s sharing tools to spread the word.

Basmeh and Zeitooneh started as a group of volunteers dedicated to serving Syrian refugees in Lebanon.  Soon afterwards, the group transformed into a registered non-governmental organization, whose primary goal is to motivate Syrian youth and women that are victimized by the conflict.
Basmeh and Zeitooneh’s role has been to find and initiate avenues for those affected by the conflict to develop their skills, and lead a life of dignity. Basmeh and Zeitooneh has established three community centers in Lebanon's most densely populated refugee camps (Shatila, Burj Al Barajneh and Bar Elias).
What We Need & What You Get
 
Basmeh and Zeitooneh's Women's Workshop aims to empower women that currently provide financial support to their families, and to help restore their sense of dignity which many have missed since their arrival to Lebanon. The workshop involves training in embroidery and in crochet, and subsequently allows the women an opportunity to sell their production,  thus facilitating their access to an income.
This campaign will ensure that the Workshop continues for an additional 6 months until it reaches self-sustainability. Basmeh and Zeitooneh aspires to continue offering a space for the women to be creative, productive and to feel empowered. The money will keep 90 women from going back to a life they chose to leave, and will enable more women from the camp to join our project, and lead a life of dignity.

Your donations to the campaign will be utilized to achieve the self-sustainability of the workshop. In order to achieve self-sustainability, Basmeh and Zeitooneh will utilize your funds to:
1- Expand the number of participants in the Women’s Workshop, and buy the materials necessary for the participants to produce their products.
2-Design and Implement a branding and a marketing strategy to sell the products all over the world.3- Design and launch a website for the organization, and launch an E-shop to allow customers from all over the world to place customized orders and support our workshop.
What You Get:

As an organization, we  value your donations and acknowledge that you are playing a pivotal role in the lives of Syrian female refugees. With your donations, we will be launching a website that we will use to sell the products of the women’s workshop and to keep our cherished supporters up-to- date with all the activities of the organization.In the meantime, in order to keep our supporters involved, the organization will be developing a newsletter which will be circulated by email. We also hope that you will follow our facebook page, where you can access information about our daily activities.
  The Impact 
Within one year, the participants in the workshop have expanded exponentially from entailing 10 participants to a total of 90 employees. The women were all housewives back in Syria, whose sole concern in life was caring for their children and their household. Today, however, they are active members of the community who support themselves and their families. Their access to an income has dramatically improved both their confidence and their decision-making powers within the household. It also gives these Syrian women a future, as the skills they are learning can be applied anywhere, which will enable them to continue working when they return to Syria. Furthermore, Syrian women are not solely reliant on humanitarian aid anymore, as they are able to earn their own money. When 90 more people can be employed by Basmeh & Zeitooneh that means 90 more families are being able to become self sustainable and not relying on aid. The whole project will become self sustainable because of the profits being made by selling the products.
Risks & Challenges
  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal. 
Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges. 
  Other Ways You Can Help 
You can always be part of positive change, even if you can’t contribute financially but you can do a lot by: 1-Be an active part of the change and donate.2-Find and follow us on our Social media channels, we go by the handler (@basmehzeitooneh).3-Invite and encourage your  friends to follow  our Social Media Channels.4- Generate buzz by Inviting your friends to share the campaign .5- Don’t forget to use Indiegogo’s sharing tools to spread the word.

story:
Ramadan is a holy month where the rich share there wealth with the less fortunate. 

It is written in the Qur'an that no one should have to go out and beg for food. 

This is why the Palestinian Society for Care and Development at al-Amari refugee camp in Ramallah, delivers food to over 350 people daily during the month of Ramadan. 

The beneficiaries of these meals are the elderly, the handicapped, orphans, big families with a lot of children, sick people, as well as people out of work. 

The lovely food they distribute is prepared by the women who life in the camp and it's distributed by a group of boy scouts. All the people involved in this project are volunteers. 

Project iftar, meaning breaking the fast, has been successfully realised for over 15 years now even though the government hasn't paid a Shekel to support it.

The enterprise costs around 3000 Shekels a day, which is around 800 US-Dollar. 

That is why we are looking for you guys to invest in this project. 

Since we cook the food ourselves at the camp the cost is held to a minimum. This way you know that the money is going directly to those in need. 

There's a saying in Arabic that those who are not willing to share their riches with the less fortunate during Ramadan, won't be able to taste their food at night. 

So let's all chip in and make our food taste great!

story:
Join the movement!  Make a tax-deductible donation today.

 

 

Letting the Science Speak

There are several hundred peer-reviewed scientific publications published over the last 7 decades by leading research scientists, and public health agencies that have confirmed that thimerosal is a potent neurotoxin.

Robert F. Kennedy Jr. published a book, Thimerosal: Let the Science Speak that summarizes these scientific publications which confirm that thimerosal has never been proven safe for use and that cost-effective alternatives exist. It is beyond time for the use of mercury in medicine to finally end.

Studies Linking Mercury to Autism:

A case-control study of Mercury burden in children with Autism Spectrum Disorders.  Bradstreet et al., Journal of American Physicians and Surgeons, 2003

Mercury, lead, and zinc in baby teeth. J.B. Adams et al., Journal of Toxicology and Environmental health, 2007

Collected Thimerosal-Autism Studies

Studies Linking Mercury to Alzheimer's:

Inorganic mercury and Alzheimer's disease. J. Mutter et al., Journal of Alzheimer's Disease, 2010

Association between dental amalgam fillings and Alzheimer's disease. Sun et al., Alzheimer's Research and Therapy, 2015

Studies Linking Mercury to ADD/ADHD:

Prenatal exposure to mercury and fish consumption during pregnancy and ADHD-related behavior in children. Sagiv et al., Arch Pediatric Adolescent Medicine, 2012

Studies Linking Mercury to Heart Disease:

The Role of Mercury in Cardiovascular Disease. Houston MC. Journal of Cardiovascular Diseases and Diagnosis, 2014.

Role of mercury toxicity in Hypertension, Cardiovascular Disease, and Stroke.  Mark C. Houston, MD., Journal of Clinical Hypertension, 2011

Prevent Mercury Intake to Stop Heart Disease. Russell Blaylock, MD., Newsmax Health, 2016

 

We're not anti-vaccine.  We are anti-mercury.

It's time to get it out of our pharmaceuticals.

 

In an effort to remove mercury from all medical products, we plan to take a multi-pronged approach to  raising awareness regarding the potential harm from the unnecessary use of mercury in medical products.

Designed by Freepik

 

Educating Families

Goals

We will conduct public outreach to educate families regarding harm associated with exposure to mercury in our medicines.  This outreach will also include efforts to correct some of the misinformation perpetuated by the media and our federal agencies that mercury has been removed from vaccines except in “trace amounts,” mercury in vaccines is not harmful and does not accumulate in the body.

Use of Funds

  • Publishing numerous articles through social media and our website.
  • Investing in writing, editing, publication and infrastructure for educational content.

Educating Congress

Goals

Congressional briefing and meetings in an effort to educate Congress on the need to provide oversight and recommendations to our federal agencies regarding the unnecessary and dangerous use of mercury in our medicines.

Use of Funds

  • Travel and setup for Congressional briefings
  • Development and printing of educational materials
  • Staffing phones to ensure maximum attendance by members of Congress

Educating the Media

Goals

Encouraging and informing the media to cover the dangers of mercury in medical products with balanced and accurate reporting.

Use of Funds

  • Sponsored press conference at National Press Club
  • Live satellite media tour with Robert De Niro and Robert F. Kennedy, Jr.

 

Grassroots Action

We are using Indiegogo as a platform to help our supporters be a part of the change.  This allows us to raise funds for our goal and assemble a team of devoted advocates at the same time.

When you donate to our campaign, we'll keep you up to date on all of World Mercury Project's progress.  We will also give you links to articles, studies, and content you can share with your friends, family, elected officials, and local media to help fight for change.

 

We have several levels of support for the campaign.  Make a tax-deductible donation today!

 

Click to learn more about our team!

Our Vision 

A world where mercury is no longer a threat to the health of our planet and people.

Our Mission 

We will work aggressively to reduce exposure to all sources of mercury, hold those accountable who failed to protect our planet and people from unnecessary exposure, restore health to those who have been harmed, and make sure this tragedy never happens again.

 

FAQs

How much of the raise will go towards the cause?

Indiegogo and credit card processors charge a small percentage of donation transactions.  Apart from these service charges, fully 100% of the campaign raise will go towards our efforts to eliminate mercury from medical products.

 

How do I get a tax-deductible receipt?

As the World Mercury Project is a 501(c)(3) Charitable Organization, your donations are tax-deductible.  

When you make a contribution, you will receive an email confirmation of your donation from Indiegogo.  Tax receipts will be provided to all backers by the World Mercury Project financial team after the completion of the campaign.

 

Why doesn't Indiegogo list your campaign listed as a Verified Nonprofit?

Indiegogo automatically adds a "verified nonprofit" banner to the top of campaigns that register through their nonprofit funding processor, FirstGiving.  However, Indiegogo is moving to a new payment processor on March 1st, right in the middle of our campaign.  If we had registered with FirstGiving, our campaign would have to end as soon as their partnership ended.

While we don't have the "verified nonprofit" banner for this reason, since World Mercury Project is a registered 501(c)(3) Charitable Organization, donations are still tax-deductible - see the FAQ above.

 

If celebrities and major donors are already supporting, why should I help?

All of our budget is not covered by major donors. World Mercury Project depends on the generous donations from everyone interested in stopping the use of mercury in all medical products and vaccines.

 

I have more questions.  Whom do I ask?

We'll be happy to answer any questions you have about our campaign.  You can reach us at indiegogo@worldmercuryproject.org

 

 

 

Citations

1: ADHD / Autism / Alzheimer's / Heart Disease

2: Black, Simon. (2016, December 06) Trace Amounts - Documentary Film

3: "Mercury in Drugs and Biologics"

story:
WHAT IS HUNGER VAN?

Hunger Van is a mobile soup kitchen created by Zamir Hassan in 2011 that feeds the homeless in your community.

Volunteers from all over the nation, regardless of their race, creed, faith, background or age get together as one community to prepare food and feed the homeless.

We at Hunger Van believe that Hunger has NO religion and we can make a difference in a person’s life by providing them with a healthy and nutritious meal. 


HOW IS HUNGER VAN DIFFERENT FROM OTHER FEEDING PROGRAMS?

We have one goal and that is “To Feed The Hungry”.

People do not need to qualify or have a voucher to receive a meal.

Our definition of hunger is simple, “if a person does not know where his/her next meal is coming from, then he/she is considered hungry.”


OUR GOAL FOR THIS CAMPAIGN

Our goal is to create awareness and expand our effectiveness by an additional 5000 meals for 2015.

For every $5 donated one homeless person will receive a freshly prepared, nutritious meal served with dignity and love.


OUR FOOD & SERVICES 

Hunger Van believes that everyone deserves a healthy and nutritious meal. So our dedicated volunteers work together all over the country to prepare every meal from scratch. 




OUR IMPACT SO FAR

Hunger Van started off as a small project but has expanded considerably over the last 4 years. We serve around 1500 meals / week just in the NY/NJ area and have over 3000 volunteers nationwide.

Please take a look at our fancy charts for a visual impact of our rapid growth.


OUR HURDLES

The need is extensive, and with your help we can do so much more.

We have enthusiastic volunteers willing to go out of their way to help and the majority of our funding goes towards preparing the food.

We are considered a grass roots project but are looking to greatly expand our operations. We can only do this with your help.


HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Donate:

Your generosity could help save lives. By donating $50 your compassion will go a long way. It will bring 10 meals to homeless and hungry people who could be your neighbors. And, by giving even $5 you will feed one person in need. 

Spread the Love:

Please help us by spreading the word.

Pass on this campaign to your friends on Facebook, Twitter and other social networking sites that you use.

Hunger Van would like to take a moment and thank all our existing Volunteers, Host Agencies, and Partners for working with us. We could not have served thousands of people without your help! Please take a moment to share our campaign with your friends and family. 


Join our efforts and volunteer with Hunger Van. 

Visit our website for more information about us: http://www.hungervan.org

Hunger Van is a project of Our Place Inc - A not for profit 501 c(3) registered in the state of New Jersey

Tax ID# 22-3782252.

story:
We are the Las Vegas community that mourns the tragic death of 2 of their heroic police officers shot and killed by reckless gunmen leaving their loved ones. Through the official pledge destination of IPOF (Injured Police Officers Fund), we seek voluntary pledge from the public.

 

Las Vegas, NV is not just a tourist destination, it is a community of residence of diverse origins. This highly active city is protected by first responders no different than any other city and communities. Today, a tragedy strikes the hearts of the community in losing 2 of our own in a reckless and needless act of violence.


The tragic death of these heroes are survived by their families and by those who were protected by them. It is our will as a community to support and pledge toward those who lost their lives in duty and their families left now without a husband, father, son, and friend.


Our goal is to raise $10,000.00 or more for IPOF, Injured Police Officers Fund specific to the above incident. This contribution will help toward reducing the financial burden by police officers and their families. 


Las Vegas is one of many communities across the country, and these types of tragedy is not welcome by any community. The unfortunate incident of loss of innocent lives should not be forgotten nor the service of those who serve the public to include their loved ones. 


Our efforts in raising the funds extend in remembering the importance of that, we are not alone, there are more than just us, and that the cause of community support will overcome and out weigh the violent attention. 


We ask that this attention be shared across all communities in silencing the violent noise, and speak loudly toward the cause for the heroes and their families far beyond Las Vegas.

story:
Mamas of Color Rising is an all-volunteer collective of women and mothers of color who are devoted to making a full range of prenatal and birthing options, including doula/birth companion support and midwifery care, accessible to ALL women, especially  those who receive Medicaid, are uninsured or undocumented.

Over the past two years we have trained ourselves and 15 other women in our community to become certified birth companions (doulas) through our Sankofa Birth Companion Project. This year we are working to expand our campaign so that Birth Companions will be providing free birth education and continuous labor support to poor women of color alongside volunteer midwives and physicians at a local Austin medical clinic. We also continue to work with our partners in the midwifery community  in the fight to get Texas Medicaid to add all midwives as providers who can be reimbursed for their services to poor pregnant women of color.

Please consider donating to Mamas of Color Rising  in YOUR mother's honor this Mother’s Day!!!

All donations go directly to funding the operational costs of our Birth Justice Campaign -- including medical and testing supplies, resource development and printing, transportation for participants –  and to support our ability to connect with birth justice movers and shakers  around the country.  As an all-volunteer collective organization, Mamas of Color Rising depends on grassroots support from allies like you to help us achieve our visión of Birth Justice for all women!

 Visit www.mamasofcolorrising.wordpress.com to learn more about Mamas of Color Rising!

story:
Short Summary

For so long, most media networks have portrayed Haiti as one of the poorest countries in the Western hemisphere. They think the best way to help is to bring everything to the Haitian people (Food, clothes, etc) leave them with no creativity or adequate education to be self sufficient. After more than 25 years no real changes have taken place there. After thinking about other approaches and strategies, we realized it will be better if we help create and establish a mentality of self sufficiency through a massive education; while trying to convince investors, tourists and corporations to come to invest in Haiti by giving them a unique investment opportunity and showing them the potentials of this country.

HAITI TOURISM Inc. is a US based corporation of young Haitian students and professionals. It was founded by the “Our Voice Achievers Award” nominated, Davidson Toussaint December 28, 2011. HTI mission is to promote the natural beauty of Haiti through not only virtual view of Haiti, but also through: Excursions, Scenic Tours, and Historic sites explorations. The ultimate goal is to contribute to the development of Haiti's tourism and Haiti’s economy. We have been recognized officially by the Consulat d’Haiti in Miami, and the Minister of Tourism in Haiti and have reached more than 7 million people in more than 143 countries.

 The platform of “EDUCATE THE WORLD ABOUT HAITI” (EWAH), has been created to promote the potentials of Haiti through events that expose the natural beauty, and the true culture of the Haitian people.The first edition of EWAH took place in Tokyo and Okinawa, Japan in 2012. It is our honor to announce the second edition of EWAH that will take place in Amsterdam and Rotterdam, Netherlands, next October 2013.

What We Need & What You Get

This year Artisanal material, printing, and promotion materials such as posters, banners and Haiti clothing, the decoration, and travel cost for our Chef are more than $9000, and we need your help to make to cover this part of the budget.

We will appreciate your hel

Break it down for folks in more detail:

 

THE IMPACT


This Campaign is part of our work to attract more investors in Haiti, which is the best way to create Job and help people over there.

contribute to this project is also a way to help people in Haiti to be self sufficient, to create Job, to help build infratructure and a better future for the Haitian people.

Be part of the big impact that will change a lot of lives in Haiti.

Other Ways You Can Help

We also know some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Use the link on your facebook

They think the best way to help is to bring everything to the Haitian people (Food, clothes, etc) leave them with no creativity or adequate education to be self sufficient. After more than 25 years no real changes have taken place there. After thinking about other approaches and strategies, we realized it will be better if we help create and establish a mentality of self sufficiency through a massive education; while trying to convince investors, tourists and corporations to come to invest in Haiti by giving them a unique investment opportunity and showing them the potentials of this country.
HAITI TOURISM Inc. is a US based corporation of young Haitian students and professionals. It was founded by the “Our Voice Achievers Award” nominated, Davidson Toussaint December 28, 2011. HTI mission is to promote the natural beauty of Haiti through not only virtual view of Haiti, but also through: Excursions, Scenic Tours, and Historic sites explorations. The ultimate goal is to contribute to the development of Haiti's tourism and Haiti’s economy. We have been recognized officially by the Consulat d’Haiti in Miami, and the Minister of Tourism in Haiti and have reached more than 7 million people in more than 143 countries.
 The platform of “EDUCATE THE WORLD ABOUT HAITI” (EWAH), has been created to promote the potentials of Haiti through events that expose the natural beauty, and the true culture of the Haitian people.The first edition of EWAH took place in Tokyo and Okinawa, Japan in 2012. It is our honor to announce the second edition of EWAH that will take place in Amsterdam and Rotterdam, Netherlands, next October 2013.


What We Need & What You Get
This year Artisanal material, printing, and promotion materials such as posters, banners and Haiti clothing, the decoration, and travel cost for our Chef are more than $9000, and we need your help to make to cover this part of the budget.
We will appreciate your hel
Break it down for folks in more detail:
 
THE IMPACT
This Campaign is part of our work to attract more investors in Haiti, which is the best way to create Job and help people over there.
contribute to this project is also a way to help people in Haiti to be self sufficient, to create Job, to help build infratructure and a better future for the Haitian people.
Be part of the big impact that will change a lot of lives in Haiti.


Other Ways You Can Help
We also know some of you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use the link on your facebook

story:
Help activists travel to Chicago!

Socialism 2015 is a four-day conference bringing together hundreds of socialists and radical activists from around the country to take part in discussions about Marxism, working-class history, and the debates and strategies for organizing today.

Every year, the Socialism conferences aims to be a place where activists can share lessons from their struggles—from the boycott, divestment and sanction campaign for Palestine to the fight for LGBT liberation, from the Fight for 15 to the struggle to stop the destruction of the planet, the fight against racism, and more.

With well over 100 meetings, the weekend will feature left-wing authors and thinkers discussing the debates on the left today, as well as meetings on the hidden history of working-class and socialist struggles.

Help Seattle-area activists travel to this incredible conference by donating today!

What We Need

There's no free lunch under capitalism and we need our community to help make the conference financially accessible to all.

  • $50 helps offset the cost of shared lodging for the weekend
  • $100 pays the cost of registration
  • $500 pays the cost of a single airline ticket 
No donation is too big or too small! We are grateful for any amount you are able to donate.

The Impact

The more we raise the more folks we can help with travel expenses. We want as many people involved in the debates, discussions, and workshops that are going to help build our movements. From Black Lives Matter to abortion access to the struggle against standardized testing and so much more, we have so much to learn from each other and the history of our struggles. Help bring those lessons back to Seattle!

Please help spread the word!

If you aren't able to donate today we would shower you with high fives for passing our campaign along to other folks in your community!
  • Ask friends, family members, co-workers, and other activists to support our campaign.
  • Use the sharing tools to promote our cause on social media. You rock!

story:
All proceeds go to the our charitable partners.

America was built by people of different ethnicities and creeds, who came to this country with a dream. This has made America great - walls and bigoted statements are the antithesis of this country. Our event will support others in achieving their American dream. We have chosen to donate all proceeds to charities whose mission is to empower low-income students in achieving higher education. 

Who are we?

We are four friends. Mara and James have worked side by side on several design projects. Luke, David and James met in college while studying design. We know this U.S. election is too important to idly stand by and watch, and feel compelled to do something about it.

Why a wall?

Our hope is that by building this ridiculously MASSIVE wall, we can use Trump's words against him to grab the attention of media, Trump supporters, and Mr. Trump himself - in an attempt to fight the hate-speech and lies that pervade his campaign.  We want to start a conversation - to remind people that this election is about much more than Republicans or Democrats. We are deciding on the next role model for the youth our country, on whether or not diversity is seen as something to celebrate or fear.  We need to make the right decision.

Our wall will make a difference

All donations will go to the “I Have A Dream” Foundation, whose mission is to fight discrimination by promoting higher education in low-income communities.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Your $10 donation allows you to drop one heavy sandbag in front of Trump's property. Together we are going to make a BIG statement. With every donation you will have access to this invoice, which we recommend you mail to the attention of Donald Trump for reimbursement. 
  • Your $50 gives you a chance to speak out. Take this opportunity to send a message to Trump. We will embed a Youtube video of your choosing on our webpage (in addition to delivering a sandbag for you). 
  • We need to raise $60,000. We've been quoted $30,000 for the delivery of 10,000 25 lb sandbags from Sandbags LLC - a national sandbag supplier, who has a distribution center 45 minutes from Central Park in New Jersey. Additionally, it will cost $15,000 to remove the sandbags. The remaining $15,000 will go to purchasing event permits from the Central Park Authorities, hiring security, and insurance. Anything in excess will be donated to the "I Have a Dream" Foundation. 
  • The more money we raise, the bigger this wall can be. The economies of scale work such that our removal fees increase only slightly with every 5,000 sandbags purchased. This means more funds for our friends at The Foundation.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal - every dollar raised will go to the "I Have a Dream" Foundation. 

Risks & Challenges

We've been working tirelessly since April to make this a reality. We've met with various authorities to ensure everything checks out. Citywide Special Events has been incredibly helpful in coordinate the logistics. We are still working out the details of the final location. As you can imagine, dropping 250,000 pounds of sand anywhere in NYC can congest traffic, especially in Central Park. Our first preference for the event is on the edge of Central Park at W59th St and Ave of Americas. Our second choice is Central Park West and W 59th ST, in front of Trump International. Our backup location is 72nd St Traverse and Terrace Drive. We will settle on the exact location in mid-August.

You can trust us to deliver. We are four super dedicated and disciplined individuals, with a vision for something big. Collectively, our team consists of professional designers, event organizers, mechanical engineers, and crazy party throwers. After all, this isn't rocket science - we're just delivering a ton of sandbags (125 tonnes to be exact). It will happen with your help

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe theres nothing scarier than a world where Trump is president - then join us - share with your friends - Let's make this happen!

story:
This campaign has now ended, we however prepare to continue our efforts to setup the fund and are preparing a new website about it. If you wish to contribute, please contact us at info@a11y.ltd.uk .

Losing one’s sight is bad enough, but becoming a minority over night is even worse. Despite the fact that modern countries have laws to protect disabled people as a minority, every day, across the world, blind people are treated unlawfully and immorally – by states, by governments and by companies.  Blind people, however, are often simply too weak to defend themselves.

It is important that we stand up for the legal rights of minorities.

“Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice anywhere.” – Martin Luther King, Jr.

“In matters of truth and justice, there is no difference between large and small problems.”– Albert Einstein

The founder of this fund, Jan Buchal, is a blind man who has himself had experience with what injustice is like and now he wants to help other blind people as well.

We are starting three projects which will be financed from this fund in the first wave. Your contribution will make them possible.

1 - A11Y v. Czech Republic over special aids

The Czech Republic is a post-communist country in East-Central Europe.  There is a law in the Czech Republic that grants the blind people the right to obtain state allowances so that they can buy the necessary special aids that enable them to read, write, study and work.

Many blind people however quickly find out that what is granted by law can easily be denied in practice. A similar situation exists in many other countries. The A11Y company began to defend the rights of the blind people demanding that they are given the state allowance that they are in theory guaranteed by law. The Czech state has reacted by starting to persecute  this company for defending the rights of the blind people. This case is very well documented and the evidence of the wrong-doing of the state and its unlawful practices is undeniable. We have partnered with the respectable Sekanina law agency to pursue justice through international arbitration against the Czech state.

We are now 5 months into the process of international arbitration with the Czech state and standing strong. We should have a result in about a year from now.

Since this dispute is international, it will be a precedent for blind people in other countries as well.

2 - Blindness in education

The right for education is in many countries granted to citizens as a fundamental human right. In practice, however, education systems are often designed for healthy people and do not take other groups into consideration. Blind children, for example, currently have no way to use many modern highly visual study materials and this often makes education very hard or even impossible for them.

It is possible to design materials in a way that they are both visually attractive and accessible to the handicapped.

Furthermore, scientific research shows that groups are more effective if they are composed of diverse people with diverse backgrounds and abilities. If schools manage to embrace the concept of diversity and the concept of mutual learning between individuals, they can be highly successful.

The blind people can bring diversity and new perspective into classes if only they are treated as respectable, equal participants within the whole educational ecosystem. Modern technology makes this possible, now we need to make it happen.

We have a technology which makes it possible to easily transform existing educational materials such as textbooks into accessible electronic formats, braille print and large print. We have developed this technology as an Open Source project and piloted it on the first 100 textbooks.  We also have a methodology and experience in training children, students, parents, teachers and social workers to use modern technology for a real inclusion of handicapped people into the class.

We are also collecting contacts to shools, educational institutions and organizations involved in education of the blind worldwide.  The solution exists and now it is "only" necessary to deploy it in practice.  It is, however, necessary to overcome the natural concerns in peoples minds and organizational complications brought by the necessary changes.  Our experience shows this is possible, but it needs effort and support.  But the result is worth it.  Blind people will return the investment to the society if they are given a chance.  This fund aims to invest into these changes.

3 - Accessibility of computers and smartphones to the blind and the visually impaired

Modern technology can be real help to people who have problems with vision. It enables them to read, write, study and work. This technology can however also be a  big  hurdle. Even the largest technology companies design their products without any consideration for the blind. Although there are exceptions, they are few and far between.

We are currently working with Apple Inc., one of the few companies that has already made steps to include the minority of the blind people among its users, to improve the situation for the blind. We have also been long term contributors to the accessibility projects in Open Source solutions.

We firmly believe that acknowledging diversity among users, not just the blind people but all different groups, can  lead to much better software and devices for all.

We have already submitted more than a hundred detailed reports on problems of accessibility of the devices for the blind  to Apple and to other development groups and companies. We want to  step up our activity.

Our team

We are a small team of highly-dedicated individuals who have already been working to improve conditions for the blind for more than 20 years (http://brailcom.org, http://a11y.ltd.uk). We know our field thoroughly. The leader of our team, Jan Buchal, is blind himself and among our team are others who are blind or partially sighted. We have participated in international projects and on international conferences (GUADEC, SightCity, WWDC,...) , we have developed new technologies (Speech Dispatcher, BOOKOO, Wiking) and we have trained blind and visually impaired people of all backgrounds and ages.

Based on our previous work, we see it as necessary to setup this fund to defend the blind people, because increasingly often we come around cases where the rights of the blind people are threatened.

The future

We want to help  change the priorities in   society. We want to make sure that the laws which are supposed to protect the handicapped are no longer just mere declarations. We want to make sure that helping   our fellow human beings becomes a prestigious, highly valued activity. We want to give the handicapped a feeling of security and independence.

story:
**If you can not view the video above go here: http://vimeo.com/user13107741/free-the-4 **

Hey Everyone! Thank you so much for your donations.  We are still raising legal funds for the Cleveland four! Their pre-sentencing hearings are scheduled for November 5th and 6th. During these hearings the four will be presenting evidence for entrapment and arguing against the Terrorism Enhancement Charge. Every penny that is raised from now until November will go towards preparing for these hearings.  The money we are raising is not going towards a greedy lawyer’s salary. Arguing a case of this magnitude requires hiring specialists and investigators who do not do pro-bono work. There are also fees associated and equipment costs. Originally (when we were going to trial) we were trying to raise $50,000, now we are trying to raise $10,000 in the next 6 days. We have already raised $2,000 please help us reach our goal by spreading the word to your friends and family!

Short Summary

Hello, I’m Susanna and I am part of the Cleveland 4 Justice Support Committee. We are a group of friends, family members and concerned citizens who are raising awareness, doing legal support, and prison support for 4 guys who were arrested in Cleveland, OH on May 1, 2012. With this campaign we are raising $50,000 for our legal defense team for the Cleveland 4. It is vital for these 4 guys to have the best legal representation they can get because of the magnitude of what not only they are facing, but what the outcome of this case could mean for future organizing groups and activists in this country.

Larger Summary:

The Cleveland 4: Doug L. Wright, Brandon Baxter, Connor Stevens, and Joshua Stafford were arrested on May 1, 2012 after allegedly attempting to blow up a bridge outside of Cleveland,OH.. What you have to understand is that it was the FBI who came up with the plan, who got the supplies for carrying it out, and who coerced these four into coming along. This is not a conspiracy, it’s called FBI entrapment.

The FBI, was sent into Occupy Movements across the country to disrupt and discredit Occupy in the eye of the American People. In Cleveland, they sent in an informant to identify individuals they deemed to be “fringe”, who could be easily isolated and coerced to do something they would have never dreamed of without the help of the FBI. This FBI informant befriended a few of these guys and began to earn their trust by employing them and giving them endless amounts of drugs, alcohol and pharmaceuticals. Over the course of 6 months, this informant slowly isolated them from friends and family by keeping them working all day long, and never letting their supply of drugs and alcohol run out. These guys were further worn down by often staffing the night shift at the Occupy Cleveland tent. During these six months, the FBI informant started instigating conversations with the guys about doing violent actions. Many of these conversations were recorded, and are featured in the affidavit as evidence against the four. But what has been put forth is clearly taken out of context and is being used as a smear campaign to paint these four guys as violent anarchist terrorists. Furthermore, the FBI informant told the guys he could get C-4 and then supplied the $ to buy it.  These guys weren’t looking for explosives, and would have never had money or the incentive to buy them. This scenario was completely masterminded by the FBI and made possible with their $ and supplies.

But why would the FBI want to create terrorists you ask?

If you look at the history of activist movements in the US you will find a track record of FBI involvement. From the red scare, to co-intelpro – where the FBI infiltrated the anti-war movement, the civil rights movement and the Black liberation movements of the 60’s and 70’s, to the Green Scare—where FBI targeted environmental and animal rights groups, to again the anti-war movements and anti-capitalist movements of the 90’s and 2000’s and now the Occupy Wallstreet movement.

But why the Occupy wallstreet movement?

Occupy Wallstreet is a movement for economic justice in the US. It appeals to the 99% of people living in this country who own 1% of the wealth. Occupy Wallstreet began as a protest against the government bailing out banks and multi-million dollar corporations after the finacial crisis of 2008. Occupy Wallstreet asked the question “why are we bailing out these corporations who are using the $ for CEO bonuses instead of bailing out the American people who are losing their homes and jobs across the country”. This question resonated with the majority of people in America. Well, corporations didn’t like that, they wanted business as usual. So the FBI was sent in to the Occupy Movement to disrupt, discredit and destroy it from the inside out. And how do they do this? They link occupy with actions and words that already have a negative connotation amongst the American People, like: weapons of mass destruction, terrorists, and anarchists—they even wanted the Cleveland 4 trial to start on Sept. 11th! With the help of the media, this entrapment is working. After a showy FBI press conference, newspapers eagerly printed sensational headlines about anarchist terrorist cells plotting a string of bombings.

The city evicted Occupy Cleveland from their downtown encampment, the group canceled their Mayday actions, and they officially turned their backs on the four, issuing a face-saving statement distancing themselves from these dedicated members of the movement. In one move, the FBI refocused our attention at Occupy away from social change and the collective survival of the 99%, to pointless debates about tactics the FBI invented in the first place.

But we are not going to be silenced on this unjust entrapment!

What We Need

That is why we are building the best legal defense we can for these guys. We have hired a lawyer Terry Gilbert who is a well known civil rights attorney. Along with Terry, we need to hire an investigative team who can sift through the 70 plus hours of recordings and evidence. We need to hire specialists to use during the trial who can testify to the authenticity of the recordings and other evidence being used against the five. All of these things, plus the cost of the trial and court fees etc. amount to a huge bill. We need this money in such a short time because this trial is being fast tracked by the FBI so that the defense has as little resources and support as they can get. We have already put our own savings on the line to secure the defense. Please help us with as much contribution as you can give. All money raised will go directly to the Cleveland 4 Legal fund.

In the next 30 days, we hope to raise at least $50,000! The trial date is set for September 18th that gives us only 6 weeks to prepare!

Although this is a joint defense, all money collected for the Cleveland 4 Legal Defense fund will go solely to Connor Stevens’ legal representation. Doug L. Wright, Brandon Baxter and Joshua Stafford have court appointed attorneys with independent budgets. 

The Impact

We need to expose the FBI’s unjust tactics during this trial; the evidence is there, it’s just a matter of having the resources to do it. This trial will set a precedent as to whether the FBI can get away with this kind of entrapment in the future, these 4 guys could be any of us. We can not let 4 innocent men, who dedicated their lives to fighting for justice, be used like puppets by the government to make an example to scare other people from expressing their 1st amendment rights.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit our website for other ways you can support the Cleveland 4. And help spread the word and make some noise about this campaign.

Hey Everyone! Thank you so much for your donations.  We are still raising legal funds for the Cleveland four! Their pre-sentencing hearings are scheduled for November 5th and 6th. During these hearings the four will be presenting evidence for entrapment and arguing against the Terrorism Enhancement Charge. Every penny that is raised from now until November will go towards preparing for these hearings.  The money we are raising is not going towards a greedy lawyer’s salary. Arguing a case of this magnitude requires hiring specialists and investigators who do not do pro-bono work. There are also fees associated and equipment costs. Originally (when we were going to trial) we were trying to raise $50,000, now we are trying to raise $10,000 in the next 6 days. We have already raised $2,000 please help us reach our goal by spreading the word to your friends and family!
Short Summary
Hello, I’m Susanna and I am part of the Cleveland 4 Justice Support Committee. We are a group of friends, family members and concerned citizens who are raising awareness, doing legal support, and prison support for 4 guys who were arrested in Cleveland, OH on May 1, 2012. With this campaign we are raising $50,000 for our legal defense team for the Cleveland 4. It is vital for these 4 guys to have the best legal representation they can get because of the magnitude of what not only they are facing, but what the outcome of this case could mean for future organizing groups and activists in this country.
Larger Summary:
The Cleveland 4: Doug L. Wright, Brandon Baxter, Connor Stevens, and Joshua Stafford were arrested on May 1, 2012 after allegedly attempting to blow up a bridge outside of Cleveland,OH.. What you have to understand is that it was the FBI who came up with the plan, who got the supplies for carrying it out, and who coerced these four into coming along. This is not a conspiracy, it’s called FBI entrapment.
The FBI, was sent into Occupy Movements across the country to disrupt and discredit Occupy in the eye of the American People. In Cleveland, they sent in an informant to identify individuals they deemed to be “fringe”, who could be easily isolated and coerced to do something they would have never dreamed of without the help of the FBI. This FBI informant befriended a few of these guys and began to earn their trust by employing them and giving them endless amounts of drugs, alcohol and pharmaceuticals. Over the course of 6 months, this informant slowly isolated them from friends and family by keeping them working all day long, and never letting their supply of drugs and alcohol run out. These guys were further worn down by often staffing the night shift at the Occupy Cleveland tent. During these six months, the FBI informant started instigating conversations with the guys about doing violent actions. Many of these conversations were recorded, and are featured in the affidavit as evidence against the four. But what has been put forth is clearly taken out of context and is being used as a smear campaign to paint these four guys as violent anarchist terrorists. Furthermore, the FBI informant told the guys he could get C-4 and then supplied the $ to buy it.  These guys weren’t looking for explosives, and would have never had money or the incentive to buy them. This scenario was completely masterminded by the FBI and made possible with their $ and supplies.
But why would the FBI want to create terrorists you ask?
If you look at the history of activist movements in the US you will find a track record of FBI involvement. From the red scare, to co-intelpro – where the FBI infiltrated the anti-war movement, the civil rights movement and the Black liberation movements of the 60’s and 70’s, to the Green Scare—where FBI targeted environmental and animal rights groups, to again the anti-war movements and anti-capitalist movements of the 90’s and 2000’s and now the Occupy Wallstreet movement.
But why the Occupy wallstreet movement?
Occupy Wallstreet is a movement for economic justice in the US. It appeals to the 99% of people living in this country who own 1% of the wealth. Occupy Wallstreet began as a protest against the government bailing out banks and multi-million dollar corporations after the finacial crisis of 2008. Occupy Wallstreet asked the question “why are we bailing out these corporations who are using the $ for CEO bonuses instead of bailing out the American people who are losing their homes and jobs across the country”. This question resonated with the majority of people in America. Well, corporations didn’t like that, they wanted business as usual. So the FBI was sent in to the Occupy Movement to disrupt, discredit and destroy it from the inside out. And how do they do this? They link occupy with actions and words that already have a negative connotation amongst the American People, like: weapons of mass destruction, terrorists, and anarchists—they even wanted the Cleveland 4 trial to start on Sept. 11th! With the help of the media, this entrapment is working. After a showy FBI press conference, newspapers eagerly printed sensational headlines about anarchist terrorist cells plotting a string of bombings.
The city evicted Occupy Cleveland from their downtown encampment, the group canceled their Mayday actions, and they officially turned their backs on the four, issuing a face-saving statement distancing themselves from these dedicated members of the movement. In one move, the FBI refocused our attention at Occupy away from social change and the collective survival of the 99%, to pointless debates about tactics the FBI invented in the first place.
But we are not going to be silenced on this unjust entrapment!
What We Need 
That is why we are building the best legal defense we can for these guys. We have hired a lawyer Terry Gilbert who is a well known civil rights attorney. Along with Terry, we need to hire an investigative team who can sift through the 70 plus hours of recordings and evidence. We need to hire specialists to use during the trial who can testify to the authenticity of the recordings and other evidence being used against the five. All of these things, plus the cost of the trial and court fees etc. amount to a huge bill. We need this money in such a short time because this trial is being fast tracked by the FBI so that the defense has as little resources and support as they can get. We have already put our own savings on the line to secure the defense. Please help us with as much contribution as you can give. All money raised will go directly to the Cleveland 4 Legal fund.
In the next 30 days, we hope to raise at least $50,000! The trial date is set for September 18th that gives us only 6 weeks to prepare!
Although this is a joint defense, all money collected for the Cleveland 4 Legal Defense fund will go solely to Connor Stevens’ legal representation. Doug L. Wright, Brandon Baxter and Joshua Stafford have court appointed attorneys with independent budgets. 
The Impact
We need to expose the FBI’s unjust tactics during this trial; the evidence is there, it’s just a matter of having the resources to do it. This trial will set a precedent as to whether the FBI can get away with this kind of entrapment in the future, these 4 guys could be any of us. We can not let 4 innocent men, who dedicated their lives to fighting for justice, be used like puppets by the government to make an example to scare other people from expressing their 1st amendment rights.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please visit our website for other ways you can support the Cleveland 4. And help spread the word and make some noise about this campaign.

story:
Catching Rain 2016

Project 509 works in Haiti, helping improve access to clean drinking water in remote mountain villages. Every day, people (mostly children) walk 2-4 hours round-trip just to bring drinking water home from streams that are contaminated with a variety of waterborne disease.  In the villages where we work, dozens of people die each year from cholera alone. 

These communities lack basic sanitation education, the resources to promote personal hygienic practices, water filtration technologies or infrastructure, and the ability to combat waterborne disease in general.  Nor are there any legitimate roads into the area, so we pack all supplies in on mules … a four-hour trek to the first village we work in. 

In collaboration with local community leaders, we build durable, efficient, and high volume rain catchment systems, which dramatically improve access to clean drinking water; we also develop community based education programs and materials about basic sanitation and hygiene that are given in schools, churches, and to community groups, and we distribute resources – including bleach, hand soap, toilet paper and basic water filtration systems – all critical in combating waterborne diseases like cholera, and promoting basic sanitation and hygiene. 

Access to clean drinking water is the cornerstone of any healthy community – something we far too often take for granted.  Unfathomably, cholera was inadvertently brought into Haiti by the international aid community’s response to the devastating Earthquake of 2010. For the past five years, it has been our resolve to counteract this unfortunate reality … and we need your help to take our work to “the next level.”

Why We Need Your Help

In January 2016, Project 509 will begin our most ambitious effort in Haiti to date. 

We will stay in-country for 4 months, expanding on the water access improvement and sanitation education work we have been engaged with over the past five years – continuing to empower people with the resources necessary to combat water borne disease (such as cholera), and improve community health.

During this time, we will execute ten points of action:

1.  Build seven new rain catchment systems

2.  Repair and upgrade an additional seven existing systems

3.  Give educational presentations – distributing bleach, toilet paper, and hand soap – in schools, churches, and community groups in 12 different villages

4.  Conduct a resource inventory, mapping all water access points and existing rain catchment systems

5.  Identify and prioritize sites to build new, and repair existing, rain catchment systems in the future

6.  Conduct research – both quantitative and qualitative – to benchmark our effectiveness, better understand how to improve our project as we move forward, and to better position ourselves for grants

7.  Recruit community leaders, organizing them into teams that can expand on the scope of our work

8.  Identify additional areas in Haiti for future expansion

9.  Coordinate with our Haitian based NGOs – Haiti Communitere and Surge for Water – to develop and produce effective and appropriate educational materials

10.  Video and photo document our work – both process and progress – in order to better promote future campaigns, more effectively engage donors, and increase transparency

Should we not reach our $20,000 goal, due to our prior experience and existing networks, we will be able to make good use of all funding we do receive and will be able to scale down the project based on the actual funds.

Corporate Sponsorship

We are offering the opportunity for businesses, schools, churches, and community groups to sponsor our efforts and provide entire communities with the lasting gift of our most precious resource – water.

All corporate sponsors can have founder of Project 509, and 2 time TEDx presenter, Dr. Jesse Baker give a talk to your company, school, or organization, plus receive the incentives below.

·  $1000: Logo, name, and company link placed on corporate sponsors page of website (+ above perks)

·  $2500: Logo, name, company link placed on corporate sponsors page of website, and placed on video (+ above perks)

For corporate sponsorship, please contact us directly: jesse@ecofficiency.org

story:
Ryan's Little Fighters Foundation is a foundation I started honoring my son's long road he has been on.  Ryan was born with a condition called an Imperforated Anus.  At one day old he had emergency surgery.  His perfect stomach was cut open and he had a colostomy bag.  It was devastating.  We felt alone in dealing with Ryan's Needs, Surgeries, Doc Appointments, etc.  There was a lack of support and I didn't know where to turn for help or advice.

Ryan's Journey has still continued even though his initial surgeries are over.  There are many challenges he will face in the future.  1 out of 5000 babies are affected by this condition and many cases are worse than Ryan's.  Imagine thinking your baby is healthy and then finding out the devastating news and the rolleroaster ride that follows.  But then imagine a foundation, that can try and take some of the stress away and offer support.  That is my goal.

I wanted to start this foundation to help other families going through what we went through.  To help them pay for medical supplies & offer advice and support. 

I'm asking for your help to get this foundation going.

story:
Before COVID-19, 130 million girls worldwide were out of school. Now, it’s predicted that 20 million more girls will never return.

With the pandemic gutting economies globally and families losing jobs and money, the impact on girls is clear. In this new reality, girls are working outside of the home, facing higher rates of child marriage, or simply picking up more housework and chores as their access to school plummets. Only 25% of low income countries have the means to continue online education, and for the millions of girls without internet access, their academic careers are on indefinite pause.

There is something we can do about it, but we need to act now. Through this #GirlsCantWait campaign, you can help She’s the First fight for girls’ safety now and a successful return to school later. We’re funding solutions that protect girls and ensure their success upon returning to school -- like ensuring mentors are available to check in with girls and building resources for organizations to plan for back-to-school during a pandemic. With the right resources, girls will not only survive this crisis: They’ll emerge as stronger leaders in their communities.

She’s the First fights to ensure girls everywhere are educated, respected, and heard. Your donation will support STF’s work in 11 countries with community-based organizations who are best positioned to support girls during this time. Share this page and get loud using #GirlsCantWait, and together we can prevent a global health crisis from becoming a global girl crisis. 

It’s time to fight for a world where every girl can choose her own future.

_________________________________________________________________________________

Our girl-centered COVID-19 response efforts focus on three pillars:

  1. Food, water, and hygiene supplies for girls & families
  2. Mentorship programs monitoring girls' safety & mental well-being
  3. Providing access to technology & adapting curriculum for remote learning

To date, our COVID-19 Response Fund has:

  • Delivered food, water, and menstrual kits to 1,439 girls and their families
  • Ensured mentors can reach 6,139 girls
  • Adapted education materials and methods reaching 6,810 girls
  • Continued funding ongoing program costs for 9,900 girls
  • 60+ communities reached

Girls are counting on us. Let’s keep going.
