RISK & CHALLENGES
The biggest risk is finishing the project by August 2021. This year has taught the whole world not to plan much, but I have been waiting for this to happen for so long and all I have left now is time and hope. You being the hope. The covid virus can ruin the plan as well, but this type of accommodation and service will work perfectly in the upcoming years. Even if we don’t do this on time, the retreat will be open.
Delivering rewards: some rewards will be delivered in 2 phases, such as planting trees. The first part is the certificate and loyalty card that will come as soon as possible in digital shape to the backer email address. The exact planting of trees will be in autumn as that is the best time to do so. That being said, the other part of the rewards, such as the photo of the tree or the birdhouse for ex. will be delivered later, again in digital shape so we avoid impact on the environment. Other rewards such as accommodation in treehouses will be possible from the moment we open the retreat, starting August or September. The backers will be welcome to come and use their rewards and see some on the property. We just need to build it. "Build it and they will come. "

Other Ways You Can Help
We need you. This forest needs you. The world needs you. 
Join the campaign, help in any way, share it, and promote us on:
 FACEBOOK     https://www.facebook.com/treelements
INSTAGRAM    https://www.instagram.com/tree.elements/
And last but not least...
THANK YOU.   For believing in the kindest eco-retreat in the world.
Power to the forest. And the people.

story:
Raw Dog Barkery

We make biologically and species appropriate treats for cats and dogs. 

Our products look like real whole food because it is real whole food.  Our real whole food products will become your dog and cats favorite treats. You will know you are feeding as good or better ingredients as you eat. 

 

The most important FIVE things to know about Raw Dog Barkery is:

  1. We LOVE Our Cats & Dogs
  2. We Are Super SERIOUS About Pet Nutrition
  3. ALL of Our Products Are Made From Real Whole Foods
  4. We Support Small Businesses Like Independent Neighborhood Pet Stores by partnering with private labeling and supporting their brand! 
  5. We have ALL of our perks in stock and are ready to ship

 SERIOUS BUT FUN

A lot of times, health food is boring.  We wanted to make a healthy, fun and exciting species appropriate treats for cats and dogs. Our products look like real food because they are real whole foods with absolutely no preservatives.  Our products look like they came from a butcher shop.  

Raw Dog Barkery products are only sourced from USDA inspected meats intended for human consumption and are made in Brookfield, Wisconsin.

 We Love What We Do and Do What We Love!

We have three full-time employees and we are working seven days a week making our products - AND LOVE IT! But, we are at capacity.

Raw Dog Barkery needs to build a monster expensive custom machine to expand our proprietary process of making biologically and species appropriate food and treats for independent neighborhood pet stores (True Small Businesses).

Ninety percent of pet foods in the US are made by two companies.  Independent neighborhood pet stores are true small business and benefit significantly from selling a private labeled incredibly unique product that can't be found at a big box store.  

We Are Just Getting Started & Need Your Help

The fact is, at Raw Dog Barkery we are just getting started and have the attention of so many independent neighborhood pet stores we can’t keep up with the demand and need your help.  

Wayne & Kevin

We Need A Large Machine

Using our proprietary process and a few special engineers we need to build a monster expensive machine ($500,000)! We are up and running with smaller machines. However, it will take nearly a year to order, build and install our new custom machine. 

Raw Dog Barkery Monster Machine Rendering

Actual Similar Machine with Different Control System & Software

If we are successful funding our new machine, we think we can change the quality of pet treats everywhere. We strongly believe we can have a significant impact on supporting small businesses because Independent neighborhood pet stores will be ultra invested in selling their brand and a product that can not be found anywhere else.

How What We Do Is Different

WHATS IS A NATURAL FOOD FOR A CAT OR DOG?

Just because something is natural doesn’t mean it should be eaten.  There are a lot of natural foods that are NOT species appropriate.  There are a lot of natural toxins too.

The most relevant question is - are you feeding a biologically or species appropriate food. Most people would not feed meat to a horse or a cow because they are herbivores. We would not expect a snake to eat grain.  Panda Bears eat bamboo, many insects eat plant leaves.  All species have species appropriate foods that they are biologically capable of digesting and obtaining nourishment from.

While many species share similar external traits; often their internal physiology to digest food is drastically different. Apes and humans have very different digestive physiologies and capabilities.  Many herd animals like cattle, sheep, goats, buffalo, deer, llamas, alpacas and camels known as ruminants or camelids have three or four stomachs.

Following The Science

Humans are classified as omnivores and have the ability to eat and survive on both plants and animal matter.  Horses, cows, rabbits, etc are classified as plant eating herbivores.

Cats & Dogs are classified as carnivores, "meat eaters". Carnivores are animals whose food and energy requirements derive solely from animal tissue or meat, whether through hunting or scavenging. Carnivores do NOT digest plant material like herbivores or omnivores and DO NOT obtain the same nutrients from them.  Even if cats and dogs  could break down the cellulose to get to the nutrients out of plant matter, their intestines are too short to get anything useful out of it.   In addition, the long-term eating of foods that are not biologically or species appropriate may cause immune or allergic reactions and a syndrome commonly known as “leaky gut”.

Dogs and Cats do get nutrients from plants when they eat prey animals that eat plants.

Medicinal Value Of Some Plants For Dogs

There are some medicinal value in some plants for dogs. Dogs are scavengers and would naturally snack on or eat small amounts of plant material, including roots, berries, and vegetation. Dogs produce very small amounts of an enzyme called amylase needed to break down plant matter. Dogs only produce enough amylase to break down already partially digested plant matter in the stomach of a very small prey animal. Therefore, dogs may have the ability to receive some medicinal values found in very small amounts of berries, spinach, etc.

Cats & Dogs may consume fruits, vegetables, and grasses; however the only nutritional value may be fiber - because natural fiber would be fur or feathers from prey animals.

RAW DOG BARKERY IS DIFFERENT

Common cat and dog foods & treats are loaded with carbs, sugar, grains, plant proteins, synthetic vitamins & minerals, preservatives or unidentifiable ingredients; often sourced from outside the United States.

Raw Dog Barkery’s products are made from familiar and easily identifiable and digestible biologically appropriate ingredients from USDA inspected sources. All of our ingredients are made from prime cuts of meat that were intended for human consumption.  Our products are gluten free, starch free, dye free,  preservative free,  and contain no artificial (or added) flavors or synthetic vitamins.

The trend of many companies in the pet industry is to advertise that their products are "sustainable" or "responsibly sourced".  This sounds well intended but is deceptive and usually means the food contains sources not intended for human consumption, involves recycling and can contain many dangerous waste products.  Raw Dog Barkery does not consider our beloved pets garbage dumps. Our products are made from nutrient dense prime cuts (not trimmings) that are intended for human consumption.  

About Us

The founders of The Raw Dog Barkery, Amy & Sean Jones believe that both humans, cats and dogs should not eat processed foods and eat only biologically and species appropriate real whole foods.  Amy is a retired special education teacher and co-owns What’s In The Bowl Pet Shops in New Berlin and Brookfield, Wisconsin.

Bonnie, Sean, Clyde, Amy & Stella

Co-Founder, Sean B. Jones has been a licensed psychotherapist for nearly 30-years.  Sean has spent a successful career recommending that his human patients avoid processed foods and eat more real whole foods.  Sean believes the same is true for cats & dogs.  Sean is certified in pet nutrition, canine herbalism & raw feeding and author to the soon to be released book “Exploring Cat & Dog Nutrition”.  He has been featured on ABC, CBS, FOX, and NBC.

Sean is also the co-owner of What's In The Bowl Pet Shops and executive director of Whats In The Bowl Forum - A Wisconsin 501(c)(3) Not-For-Profit Organization: Providing discussion, education and opportunities for pet parents to explore current species appropriate nutrition, wellness, treatment and training options for their pets.He has two master’s degrees and has a passion for educating pet parents about biologically appropriate foods & supplements. Sean lives in Waukesha, Wisconsin with his wife Amy (co-owner of Whats In The Bowl Pet Shops & Raw Dog Barkery) and their three golden retrievers Bonnie, Clyde & Stella.

Our Team

Some Of Our Products

 

 

Freeze-Dried Beef Blood

 

Meat Donuts

We even make biologically and species appropriate donuts for cats and dogs. started by making chicken or pork based donuts- topped with yogurt, goat milk, cranberry, blueberry, spinach or pumpkin.  

Chicken Breast Donut with Goat Milk and Cranberry Toppings

Topped with either yogurt, goat milk, cranberry, blueberry, spinach or pumpkin.  

 

 

The Impact You Can Have!

  • We are a true family owned and operated small business and your support is critical to the success of Raw Dog Barkery
  • We have a great team with a director of production with over 15-years of human and pet food experience and founders that own a small independent neighborhood pet retail store. 
  • The Raw Dog Barkery brand is already in many independent neighbor pet stores and we partner with many more with private labeling. 

Risks & Challenges

To take Raw Dog Barkery to the next level; our risks and challenges are genuinely related to funding. We are a true small business and traditional financing is challenging. We are moving Raw Dog Barkery to dedicated production facility that has the space and electrical power requirements for our new machine. The machine we need to build costs $529,000. We are also installing walk in freezers and coolers, and commercial kitchen equipment. We are very dedicated to quality controls and disciplined in not taking on more business than we can handle. If we can not fund the new machine; we are still up and operational with smaller machines and are confident we will take our mission to the next level; but just over a longer period of time.  We are sincerely hopeful about providing small businesses like independent neighborhood pet stores with a competitive advantage over the big box stores. 

At this time, we have all of our promised rewards in stock and are ready for shipping.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have a cat or dog.  Please know that there are tremendous differences you can make in their health and lives by feeding biologically and species appropriate foods unlike what is common place in the pet food industry.  

  • To learn more please visit our website:  www.rawdogbarkery.com
  • Helpful Documentary On Pet Food:  Pet Fooled
  • Helpful Book On Dog Longevity:  The Forever Dog

story:
Hi there!

My name is Michelle Martinetti, and I'm the Founder + CEO of River Valley Arts Center. I have spent the majority of my adult life working to support my community through ACTION. I've taken action by working with area not-for-profits. I've taken action by fundraising for the Eleanor Roosevelt Center at Val-Kill, American Cancer Society, and Angels of Light. Now, I'm taking action to support unique experiences that bring the community together to celebrate creativity and the spirit of the Hudson Valley.

What if you could experience diverse programs like yoga, dance, music, art, robotics, culinary, and more all under one roof? YOU CAN!

What if you could bring your kids, all at the same time, for music lessons, tutoring, mindfulness workshops, and more? YOU CAN!

What if you could host cooking classes, run meetings, teach workshops, and more while only paying for the time you need? YOU CAN!

This is exactly why I took action and founded River Valley Arts Center in the beautiful and historic Village of Wappingers Falls. I wanted to create a space where families can gather and enrich themselves with a whole host of different arts and education programming. I wanted to support the small business community by offering a unique way for them to bring their services to customers without long-term commitment getting in the way. I wanted a place where I can watch the community come together and grow.

River Valley Arts Center is the Hudson Valley's premier multi-use facility for arts and community programs. After a ton of hard work and determination, I secured a fantastic location in the heart of the Village ripe for a renaissance. What was previously the United Methodist Church and School Annex located at 9 S Mesier Ave is now undergoing stunning renovations to breathe new life into the building. I'm working with an amazing crew to update the space by adding new lighting, sheetrock, floors and making it ADA-compliant. Once finished, the updated building will house 13 unique spaces - including 9 studios, 1 large studio/small event space, a conference room, a commissary kitchen, and finally, a stupendous event space to gather the community together.

I know that with this revitalization, our entire community will benefit. With your help, I'm hoping we can make an even greater impact! I need you to take action and help us raise funds to support our tenants and the community by outfitting our spaces to make them beautiful, accessible, and ready to go.

With the funds raised, I hope to purchase:

  • Tables and chairs for the studio spaces and event space.
  • Multimedia equipment for the event space and conference room.
  • Security to protect our guests, program leaders, and space.
  • Industrial kitchen equipment to help residents with classes, food prep, and more.
  • Mirrors, bars, mats, and other items for dance classes, yoga, etc.
  • Locking storage containers to keep items stored safely.
  • And other essential items to help our residents and community members feel at home in our spaces.

Winston Churchill once said, "We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give." I want to thank you for giving me the opportunity to share this vision with you. I hope you will choose to help support us in our mission. 

With eternal thanks and gratitude,
- Michelle Martinetti

story:
My story

I, Bobbi-Lee Smart, am a bookworm. I love books and have always loved them. Like Belle, I would have married the Beast for the library alone! Books have been one of the biggest influences in my life. They made me who I am today. Mostly romance novels which I started reading around 12 & still avidly read today, though my taste in them has changed drastically.   In my neighborhood, there was not an independent, or even chain, bookstores that I can recall. I purchased most of my books (after Scholastic book fairs) from thrift stores or swap meets. I definitely have no recollection of a space where I could hang out with other bookworms and talk about the books we were reading. This is why I decided that I needed to create the community that I wish I had when I was younger. A bookstore that is also a community space.

And because I am a nerd I went into academia and am currently an adjunct/contingent/part-time Sociology instructor in the community college system. I LOVE teaching and sharing knowledge. My favorite thing in the world is watching a student's eyes light up because the material is clicking. However, this journey has also made me realize how important it is to share knowledge outside of the traditional educational settings. Not everyone has the privilege of attending college, for a variety of reasons, and not everyone wants to attend college! That doesn't mean they don't yearn to learn & engage in conversations about books and life. 

It's also important to note that I am an intersectional feminist. When I said earlier my taste in romance novels changed, it is because as I continue to grow into my identity as an intersectional feminist, the books I previously read became less appealing. Now don't get me wrong I will always have an affinity for the authors I grew up reading, however, their books were not featuring people I could relate to as an adult. When I was a teen and even a young adult, I aspired to be like the women in the books, but as a grown woman I realized I was never going to be them and their stories were not gripping me the way they used to. Then I discovered diverse authors who told stories about diverse characters and I saw not only myself, but my friends reflected in those stories. I fell in love all over again. It's important to me that this bookstore centers books by and for diverse women so others can fall in love with reading by seeing themselves and their stories reflected in the books they are reading.

Subverting Expectations will be starting as an online bookstore (which will be live in July 2021) that also hosts pop-up booths at community events. We are also planning to be active on social media to start to create a community before we are able to open a physical space. And let me tell you we have plans for the physical space! Open mic nights, stand-up comedy, workshops ranging from writing resumes to sexual health, book clubs, and movie nights. We plan to have space for people to read, socialize, and even quiet spaces to work or study. The goal is to open the brick & mortar store within the next 2 years.

Our Mission Statement

We are an unapologetically intersectional feminist community that celebrates all things women. 

We understand that women can be multiple things at once. Women can be anything they want to be, even if those things seem contradictory. Strong and vulnerable, sexual and professional, outspoken and personable, book and street smart, analytical and into woo. Our mission is to create a space where women feel empowered to embrace every aspect of themselves.

By existing fully as ourselves, we will dismantle the patriarchy and white supremacy. By making resources accessible, Subverting Expectations is aiding and abetting people to create their own destinies and to live their most authentic lives. 

We are co-conspirators to historically underrepresented and marginalized communities. We will discuss social issues and share knowledge on how to be a part of the solution. We are here to uplift, empower, and create a safe place for everyone in the way they need and want us to.

We understand that learning happens in different forms. We not only learn by reading but also having open discussions about books and life in general. We get to learn about other people, their experiences, and how they see the world. This makes us more aware, more empathetic, and that makes the world a better place. 

We love learning. We love knowing things. We want to provide people with the opportunity to fall in love with knowledge and learning.

What is it that we need & what you get for helping:

What your donation can help us accomplish:

  • The most important place that your donations are going is to inventory, aka BOOKS! While we will be starting as an online store, we will also be doing local community pop-up events. We would like to carry roughly 500 books at any given time, which is about $5,000 worth of books. The more donations we get the wider the variety of books we will have at the pop-up events.
  • We will also need equipment to set up the pop-up booths. Tables, chairs, banners, crates to carry the books, display fixtures, a pop-up tent, and all of the other necessities to have a successful pop-up booth. This will be around $3,000.
  • We will also have merchandise available at the pop-ups, such as tumblers, mugs, bookmarks, tote bags, and more! We are budgeting $2,000 for the initial costs of these items.
  • Turns out an online bookstore costs a pretty penny. From hosting the website to the point of sales system to licensing and professional membership fees the initial start-up fees will run about another $5,000. 

The Impact

I want this to be a truly communal space where the customers help us create our community. Where people tell us what they would like us to add or incorporate and we do our best to make those things happen. This is a collaboration. And while we cannot promise to cover everything we want to be open to ideas and growth. Having an eclectic team and support system, it is imperative that Subverting Expectations bring a little bit of everything to this space for my fellow eclectics to embrace all aspects of themselves. From access to politicians, to talks about sex, to discussing current events, to learning new make-up trends, I want to create a space where everyone feels welcome, valued, and comfortable to explore new things. 

Risks & Challenges

As an independent online bookstore, it may be difficult for us to stand out and compete against a larger online retailer who shall not be named. However, we know that we offer something unique and that there has been a move to shop and support small businesses. We know that we will have to adjust and adapt as necessary and as we get to know what our community requires and desires. While there will be difficult times, we are committed to making this dream a reality. This will be a journey & we are excited to have you along for the ride.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share this campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools, follow us on social media, interact with us, and share our pages! And remember to subverts people's expectations of who they think you are supposed to be by embracing who you are. Fuck their expectations.

Instagram: @Subverting_Expectations

Twitter: @Subvert_Expects

Facebook: @Subverting Expectations
story_txt:
My story
I, Bobbi-Lee Smart, am a bookworm. I love books and have always loved them. Like Belle, I would have married the Beast for the library alone! Books have been one of the biggest influences in my life. They made me who I am today. Mostly romance novels which I started reading around 12 & still avidly read today, though my taste in them has changed drastically.   In my neighborhood, there was not an independent, or even chain, bookstores that I can recall. I purchased most of my books (after Scholastic book fairs) from thrift stores or swap meets. I definitely have no recollection of a space where I could hang out with other bookworms and talk about the books we were reading. This is why I decided that I needed to create the community that I wish I had when I was younger. A bookstore that is also a community space.
And because I am a nerd I went into academia and am currently an adjunct/contingent/part-time Sociology instructor in the community college system. I LOVE teaching and sharing knowledge. My favorite thing in the world is watching a student's eyes light up because the material is clicking. However, this journey has also made me realize how important it is to share knowledge outside of the traditional educational settings. Not everyone has the privilege of attending college, for a variety of reasons, and not everyone wants to attend college! That doesn't mean they don't yearn to learn & engage in conversations about books and life. 
It's also important to note that I am an intersectional feminist. When I said earlier my taste in romance novels changed, it is because as I continue to grow into my identity as an intersectional feminist, the books I previously read became less appealing. Now don't get me wrong I will always have an affinity for the authors I grew up reading, however, their books were not featuring people I could relate to as an adult. When I was a teen and even a young adult, I aspired to be like the women in the books, but as a grown woman I realized I was never going to be them and their stories were not gripping me the way they used to. Then I discovered diverse authors who told stories about diverse characters and I saw not only myself, but my friends reflected in those stories. I fell in love all over again. It's important to me that this bookstore centers books by and for diverse women so others can fall in love with reading by seeing themselves and their stories reflected in the books they are reading.
Subverting Expectations will be starting as an online bookstore (which will be live in July 2021) that also hosts pop-up booths at community events. We are also planning to be active on social media to start to create a community before we are able to open a physical space. And let me tell you we have plans for the physical space! Open mic nights, stand-up comedy, workshops ranging from writing resumes to sexual health, book clubs, and movie nights. We plan to have space for people to read, socialize, and even quiet spaces to work or study. The goal is to open the brick & mortar store within the next 2 years.
Our Mission Statement
We are an unapologetically intersectional feminist community that celebrates all things women. 
We understand that women can be multiple things at once. Women can be anything they want to be, even if those things seem contradictory. Strong and vulnerable, sexual and professional, outspoken and personable, book and street smart, analytical and into woo. Our mission is to create a space where women feel empowered to embrace every aspect of themselves.
By existing fully as ourselves, we will dismantle the patriarchy and white supremacy. By making resources accessible, Subverting Expectations is aiding and abetting people to create their own destinies and to live their most authentic lives. 
We are co-conspirators to historically underrepresented and marginalized communities. We will discuss social issues and share knowledge on how to be a part of the solution. We are here to uplift, empower, and create a safe place for everyone in the way they need and want us to.
We understand that learning happens in different forms. We not only learn by reading but also having open discussions about books and life in general. We get to learn about other people, their experiences, and how they see the world. This makes us more aware, more empathetic, and that makes the world a better place. 
We love learning. We love knowing things. We want to provide people with the opportunity to fall in love with knowledge and learning.

What is it that we need & what you get for helping:
What your donation can help us accomplish:
The most important place that your donations are going is to inventory, aka BOOKS! While we will be starting as an online store, we will also be doing local community pop-up events. We would like to carry roughly 500 books at any given time, which is about $5,000 worth of books. The more donations we get the wider the variety of books we will have at the pop-up events.
We will also need equipment to set up the pop-up booths. Tables, chairs, banners, crates to carry the books, display fixtures, a pop-up tent, and all of the other necessities to have a successful pop-up booth. This will be around $3,000.
We will also have merchandise available at the pop-ups, such as tumblers, mugs, bookmarks, tote bags, and more! We are budgeting $2,000 for the initial costs of these items.
Turns out an online bookstore costs a pretty penny. From hosting the website to the point of sales system to licensing and professional membership fees the initial start-up fees will run about another $5,000. 

The Impact
I want this to be a truly communal space where the customers help us create our community. Where people tell us what they would like us to add or incorporate and we do our best to make those things happen. This is a collaboration. And while we cannot promise to cover everything we want to be open to ideas and growth. Having an eclectic team and support system, it is imperative that Subverting Expectations bring a little bit of everything to this space for my fellow eclectics to embrace all aspects of themselves. From access to politicians, to talks about sex, to discussing current events, to learning new make-up trends, I want to create a space where everyone feels welcome, valued, and comfortable to explore new things. 

Risks & Challenges
As an independent online bookstore, it may be difficult for us to stand out and compete against a larger online retailer who shall not be named. However, we know that we offer something unique and that there has been a move to shop and support small businesses. We know that we will have to adjust and adapt as necessary and as we get to know what our community requires and desires. While there will be difficult times, we are committed to making this dream a reality. This will be a journey & we are excited to have you along for the ride.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please Share this campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools, follow us on social media, interact with us, and share our pages! And remember to subverts people's expectations of who they think you are supposed to be by embracing who you are. Fuck their expectations.
Instagram: @Subverting_Expectations
Twitter: @Subvert_Expects
Facebook: @Subverting Expectations

story:
velo peaches – Bicycle repair and shop 

 

We are Ana, Mischa and Jovi and together we are velo peaches, a new feminist bike repair shop opening soon in Vienna.

 

The three of us are trained bike mechanics and have worked in different workshops and bike related projects in Vienna, Graz and Novi Sad (Serbia). 

 

What will you help us achieve? 

Opening a  queer feminist bike repair shop, of which we hope to be more than a repair workshop

We see the need for a more feminist approach to cycling and bike mechanics. We really want to empower FLINTA* (Female*Lesbian*Intersex*Non-Binary*Trans*Agender*) persons to get independence on the bicycle. We also want to give space for more education for FLINTA* mechanics and make the information reachable for everyone. 

Our goal with the crowdfunding

We are aiming for 10,000 euros to go towards our renovation costs and buying all the bike tools we are going to need for the workshop.

 

What's in it for you!

With every donation we will give you a "forever place" at velo peaches! With a donation you will get your name stamped on the tool that will be used in the workshop.

 

The Impact

WHY A FEMINIST BIKE SPACE?

 After working in different bicycle spaces and companies we have seen the patriarchal structures at work, felt our voices being taken away from us, never mind the tools from our hands. We have decided that instead of trying to change the exsisting structures in bicycle workshops, we would rather create our own space. We have all experienced more than once that FLINTA* persons, mechanics as well as customers, are not taken seriously in bike and repair shops. Sometimes the male dominated space creates the feeling that the male voice is the expert voice and that there is no further discussion. FLINTA* customers can be cajoled into buying something or pressured into making decisions that are not explained or given background knowledge on. 

FLINTA* persons need a space to learn and express their technical abilities and practice them without being judged and questioned. It is  our vision that velo peaches will be that space.

 

Risks & Challenges

It's a risk to put all our money and time into buiding Velo Peaches, but no risk, no fun. Of course there will be many obstacles to overcome. Which is why we work hard not just at building the outer exterior but a strong base together to communicate honestly. We are building velo peaches with love and respect for each others voices, lifting each other up and supporting each other. More then just wanting to be successful monetarily we want to succeed in working together. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Dont worry if you cannot contribute financially to our Crowdfunding. If you want to help but don't have the capacity to give towards our financial goal, just let us know. We are in need of lots of different things for building up and opening velo peaches.

Please forward and share our campaign and let others know about what we are doing. Support feminist bike spaces!

 

Thanks for watching and reading, see you soon

Ana, Mischa and Jovina

story:
The Cookie Story

Hi Cookie Lovers! My name is Shana Taveras and I'm the founder and creator of Blackout Baking Co. My background is in fashion design and I have channeled my creative energy from sewing to baking. I'm a detail person and there’s an obsessiveness that goes into every detail of our cookies from the texture, flavor balance, shape of the cookie, packaging, etc. Basically, I love creating beautiful things that make people happy and food makes me happy.

Blackout Baking Co. is a Chicagoland bakery specializing in bite-size gourmet cookies. Perfect for gifting and events, we strive to create BLACKOUT-worthy cookies that bring us back to our childhood, but push boundaries with new flavors, textures, and forms. We've been in business as an e-commerce bakery for almost 3 years, but the concept and recipe creation started over 5 years ago. We are excited to be moving into our next chapter with a brick-and-mortar bakeshop set to open next month in downtown Oak Park, IL! Our bakeshop will be serving our bite-size gourmet cookies along with other baked goods. We're bringing in the amazing Irving Farm Coffee from NY to have a full coffee and espresso menu. With our own dedicated kitchen, we will be able to bake and ship more cookies nationwide! On top of that, we are looking to expand our merch and partner with other local businesses to feature their products in our shop. Once we get our feet under us, we hope to be a beacon for other food start-ups and support small businesses in our community.

Blackout Baking Co. started when I was living in London. I left my job as a fashion designer in NYC to live abroad with my husband. My parents are entrepreneurs and I always knew that I wanted my own business someday. As much as I loved my profession, I knew that starting my own fashion label was not what I wanted. It's a very capital-intensive industry and I felt like I knew too many of the pitfalls that made that avenue scary. I'm a big foodie and loved the amazing cuisine and mix of cultures in London. There definitely is an 'American' stereotype and that plays out in food as well. Anything 'American' was massive and filled with M&M's. I wanted to improve the association with American food and what better way to do that than with a cookie?! We all have fond memories of milk and cookies and you just can't go wrong with an amazing cookie... The bite-size form is also important to me. Personally, I always want to try everything on a menu. With our cookies, you can do that! You can also share the experience with others. 'Blackout' came to fruition after riffing on how food makes you feel. When you eat something so delicious, it's transcendent and the only thing you can think about is what you're tasting in that moment. Also, the name is a nod to the old school Brooklyn Blackout cake, which is a chocolate cake filled with chocolate pudding and topped with chocolate cake crumbs, hence 'chocolate on chocolate on chocolate'. It was invented during World War II by a Brooklyn bakery chain named Ebinger's, in recognition of the mandatory blackouts to protect the Brooklyn Navy Yard. I worked on our version of Brooklyn Blackout in our BLACKOUT Cookie™ first (Chocolate cookie, filled with dark chocolate ganache, milk chocolate chunks and topped with Maldon sea salt) and continue to improve on it. 

 

The Process, What We Need & Some Awesome VIP Perks

I am a super-planner, but going through a build-out process is no joke! Not to scare away any new business owners here, you can do it! It's tough, but anything that's worth it is and I'm so grateful to have this learning experience and be able to share it with other entrepreneurs. We're building out a full commercial kitchen and cafe in a former office space. Everything will be baked on-site with high-quality ingredients by our growing cookie crew! We're looking for additional funding to bring us over the finish line. We had some unexpected costs and the length of the project has pushed our open date.

The details: Lease was signed at the end of February 2021. We had a less than ideal working relationship with the architect and engineer that resulted in three separate permit submissions, many sleepless nights, and a panic attack. I ended up taking the reins on the project all the way down to the last detail - Yes, that means I had to teach myself all about electrical, plumbing, HVAC, etc. The design and planning process ended up taking 3.5 months and we missed the window that our contractor had set aside to start the build-out - The bright side: I know more about HVAC CFMs, electrical load, circuits, etc. In June, we had to get all new quotes and find a contractor to take us on last minute. Due to COVID, everyone is busy and materials are scarce.  We finally started at the end of July!! The icing on the cookie, all of our equipment has gone up by around 30%. We hired a new engineer to correct our drawings and through this process, we found that our building didn't have enough power to support our equipment...yay for old buildings! This resulted in having to work with the power company to bring in our own dedicated line (over 100ft from the pole). This was a very expensive addition AND we are still waiting for that power source to be hooked up. Fingers crossed it's soon! 

  • We're hoping to raise $15,000. This will cover the cost of the new electrical service, startup inventory, and startup payroll as we train our team to serve you the best damn cookies you've ever had.
  • If we surpass our goal we'll use the funds to purchase additional equipment (we have our eye on a dishwasher), create some awesome Blackout merch to rep, and hire additional people to get some solid momentum right out of the gate.
  • We have some awesome perks and VIP swag for our supporters. Check it out!

 

The Impact

Your contribution would mean so much! For our little cookie business that could, for our community, for hope in small businesses, and for the 10+ new employees joining our team. We've continued to grow year over year and persisted through COVID. The bakeshop is the next step in our vision to bring you the full BLACKOUT experience where quality meets nostalgia in an elevated cookie experience.

 

Spread The Word

A project like ours depends on word of mouth. Please share this campaign using Indiegogo’s share tools, follow us on social media, and share the story with your family and friends! 

Website: www.blackoutbakingco.com

Instagram: @blackoutbakingco

Facebook: @blackoutbakingco

story:
A bakery with a difference.

The incredible charity Communicare is very soon to be taking over a bakery!

COMMUNIBAKES

Yes that’s right. We will be taking over a bakery on St James Road in Shirley, Southampton.

But why?
1.       The profits we make through the bakery will go to Communicare to enable us to support and help more people struggling with loneliness and isolation. 
2.       This bakery has been successful the last 7 years, we believe we can build on this success with the potential of offering more to make a positive impact within the community.
3.       We want to put cake at the heart of the community.

At the moment the bakery just offers delicious cakes and tasty fresh bread.

However we see so much more potential and are therefore looking to raise £5000. With that money we will: 

1. Purchase a hot food counter, giving us the option of providing pastry's, sausage roll's and other hot treats for the community. 
2. Purchase a quality hot drinks machine. Because hey, life is too short for rubbish coffee!
3. Smarten up the bakery, such as redo the floor and redecorate where needed.

Please check out the rewards we have on offer. Please make a difference and give what you can.

We look forward to welcoming you into COMMUNIBAKES!

P.s. Please use the Indiegogo share tools (top right) to tell your friends about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else. Let's get the word out there so that we can make this bakery incredible together! Thank you!

 

Communibakes Mailing List: Please sign up here

Communibakes Twitter: @communibakes

Communibakes Instagram: @communibakes

Communibakes Facebook: Coming Soon

Communibakes Website: Coming Soon

Communicare in Southampton Website: Please click here

 

Please check out the FAQ's section in which we go into further detail and answer the questions we think we may get asked.

If you have any questions or comments that are not covered in the FAQ section, please get in contact with Nick Thomas, Development Officer of Communicare.
Tel: 07874 868 241
Email: nick@communicareinsouthampton.org.uk

story:
What is EquiTable Space?

EquiTable Space, Inc. is a LGBTQ+ and Black led charitable organization that will operate a live performance theatre and café/bar. The purpose of EquiTable Space, as its name suggests, is to create a ‘community table’ where everyone, specifically LGBTQ+ folks and people of color, has a seat. We are seeking community investment and support in order to lease property that is a live performance theater and café’ venue (aka “the Space”). The Space will be used as an environment to cultivate conversation, showcase underrepresented creatives, and nourish the soul of our community. 

     Live Performance Space

     The performance space will showcase live performances, provide practice space, and host live entertainment spanning from comedy shows to drag shows, hilarious sing-a-longs, album listening parties, dinner theatre, table readings, piano/jazz nights, and whatever the community can imagine. The Space will be offered on a sliding scale fee or at no-cost (when possible) for LGBTQ+, BIPOC, and women. We will tap into the rich and hungry Los Angeles theatre scene, providing a space for existing, current, and newly formed productions and theatre groups. 

 

     

     Z’s Café

     The café will offer a daily breakfast and lunch menu made from fresh ingredients as well as select offerings during theater productions and evenings. Z’s Café will be a place where creatives and professionals can enjoy freshly brewed coffee, espresso,  tea, and more. The café will also offer a beer and wine selection, including an exclusive menu of wine and beer flights, sourced from black-owned and/or LGBTQ+ owned breweries and wineries. To honor and recognize all of the groups Z’s Café seeks to celebrate, we will host themed-nights and events that speak to the heart and soul of community building. 

EquiTable Space Programs

In addition to the above, we will also:

  • donate to local charities;
  • round-up purchases for charitable donations, with a new charity each month;
  • host meet and greets between nonprofits and community members;
  • feature black-owned and LGBTQ owned wine, beer, and coffee, including tastings with curators;
  • offer workshops/community conversations to engage, educate and motivate; and
  • offer venue rentals/buyouts for film/tv, events (i.e. launches, premieres, book signings, etc.), networking, and other private events. 

Who is EquiTable Space’s Target Audience?

EquiTable Space will create an intentionally welcoming queer environment. ALL are welcome; however, artists, creatives, people of color, and members of the LGBTQ+ community are encouraged to come create, congregate, and relax in an environment where they are free to be their full authentic selves. 

Why Should You Give?

Did you see all of the above?... This is a worthy endeavor led by queer, professionals who believe OUR stories are all intertwined and everyone deserves a seat at the table. OUR success is YOUR success. 

Still not convinced? Check out our awesome incentives/perks, you receive for your contribution! 

STILL not convinced?? Donate anyways and join us. See what we create. We cannot wait to meet you.

Who We Are?

Zekiah N. Wright, Esq. (they/them/Mx.), is a California attorney who specializes in discrimination and labor code violations. Zekiah brings 14 years of restaurant experience to Z’s Café.  Zekiah has worked in the restaurant business in many positions including waiting tables, cooking on the line, bartending and managing the front of house. 

Zekiah decided to start EquiTable Space because they grew weary of creating change through litigating one case at a time. Instead, Zekiah decided to create an equitable space where ideas flourish and resources are spread across the community. Through this work, Zekiah hopes to bring about social and economic change. 

Jackie Steele (she/her/Ms.) is an event producer who has worked for Fortune 50 brands producing events and tours nationwide. Jackie, aka “the 5-foot monster” has also booked, promoted and produced live events in LA for the last 15 years including venues such as The Rainbow Room, The World Famous Comedy Store, and the Hollywood Improv. Jackie’s passion for live events, live performances, and local artists, along with her deep ties to the LGBTQ+ local community has fueled the fire within her to create an inclusive space for all to perform and for audiences to see stage-worthy performances. Jackie also worked with the City of West Hollywood to create the world's first Bi-Pride, which achieved global acclaim.

The dynamic union of Zekiah and Jackie came into existence because of their collective service to the LGBTQ+ community. Their combined passion for providing space, access, and a voice for all, as well as their fun-spirited “we’ll try anything twice, three times just to be sure”’ approach towards life made for a natural kinship. Their dedication to creating a collaborative environment, working hard, and manifesting purpose created a natural business partnership. 

Current Status

EquiTable Space, Inc. is incorporated as a non-profit public benefit corporation under the laws of California. We are in the process of filing for exempt status as a 501(c)(3) corporation.

We are currently in discussions with a property owner to lease a theater and café venue in Los Angeles.
story_txt:
What is EquiTable Space?
EquiTable Space, Inc. is a LGBTQ+ and Black led charitable organization that will operate a live performance theatre and café/bar. The purpose of EquiTable Space, as its name suggests, is to create a ‘community table’ where everyone, specifically LGBTQ+ folks and people of color, has a seat. We are seeking community investment and support in order to lease property that is a live performance theater and café’ venue (aka “the Space”). The Space will be used as an environment to cultivate conversation, showcase underrepresented creatives, and nourish the soul of our community. 
     Live Performance Space
     The performance space will showcase live performances, provide practice space, and host live entertainment spanning from comedy shows to drag shows, hilarious sing-a-longs, album listening parties, dinner theatre, table readings, piano/jazz nights, and whatever the community can imagine. The Space will be offered on a sliding scale fee or at no-cost (when possible) for LGBTQ+, BIPOC, and women. We will tap into the rich and hungry Los Angeles theatre scene, providing a space for existing, current, and newly formed productions and theatre groups.       
     Z’s Café
     The café will offer a daily breakfast and lunch menu made from fresh ingredients as well as select offerings during theater productions and evenings. Z’s Café will be a place where creatives and professionals can enjoy freshly brewed coffee, espresso,  tea, and more. The café will also offer a beer and wine selection, including an exclusive menu of wine and beer flights, sourced from black-owned and/or LGBTQ+ owned breweries and wineries. To honor and recognize all of the groups Z’s Café seeks to celebrate, we will host themed-nights and events that speak to the heart and soul of community building. 
EquiTable Space Programs
In addition to the above, we will also:

donate to local charities;
round-up purchases for charitable donations, with a new charity each month;
host meet and greets between nonprofits and community members;
feature black-owned and LGBTQ owned wine, beer, and coffee, including tastings with curators;
offer workshops/community conversations to engage, educate and motivate; and
offer venue rentals/buyouts for film/tv, events (i.e. launches, premieres, book signings, etc.), networking, and other private events.

Jackie’s passion for live events, live performances, and local artists, along with her deep ties to the LGBTQ+ local community has fueled the fire within her to create an inclusive space for all to perform and for audiences to see stage-worthy performances. story:
Perché credere nel nostro progetto?

Negli ultimi anni abbiamo assistito ad una crescita esponenziale di interesse verso il bio, favorendo una maggiore sensibilità nei confronti di prodotti più salutari, ecologici e cruelty free. L’interesse verso l’ambiente sta cambiando e molte persone sono passate a prediligere questi prodotti ritendendoli più adatti alla propria salute e benessere. Perché un prodotto senza additivi chimici, antibiotici, metalli pesanti, e che può anche aiutare l’ambiente e gli animali non è da poco!

Questo interesse, ovviamente, è anche incentrato nel benessere dei propri amici a 4 zampe, ormai considerati parti integranti della famiglia. Ormai milioni di famiglie in tutto il mondo hanno un animale in casa, e hanno un considerevole interesse verso il loro benessere e la loro salute.

La nostra azienda ha l’obiettivo di erogare servizi riducendo al minimo l’impatto ambientale, e quello di avere un approccio olistico nei confronti degli animali. La parola “Olistico” deriva dal termine greco “HOLOS”, che significa “tutto l’insieme, il globale”. Questa definizione racchiude in sé che l’approccio olistico tiene conto di tutte le molteplicità di aspetti e fattori che incidono nella salute e benessere, in questo caso, dei nostri amici animali. Prendendo in considerazione il contesto in cui vive, la sua alimentazione, le sue abitudini, il suo equilibrio psicofisico, la sua capacità di gestire gli stress emotivi e, le sue relazioni con gli umani o altri animali. Lavorando sulla prevenzione, per un equilibrio non solo sul piano fisico, ma anche psichico, emozionale e energetico.

Quali servizi fornirà la nostra azienda?

La nostra azienda ha la necessità di ampliare la sua struttura per poter avviare nuovi servizi per il benessere animale. Alcuni servizi sono già avviati, conosciuti e affermati nel territorio locale:

- Corsi individuali e di gruppo: educazione base (Gestione del cane in casa e in ambiente urbano) e avanzata, giusta comunicazione tra il cane e referente umano, corsi per cuccioli, recupero caratteriale (aggressività, fobie…), corsi per una socializzazione corretta, corsi per adozioni consapevoli, corsi per neo mamme o mamme in gravidanza, passeggiate di gruppo
- Sport cinofili, per rafforzare il rapporto con il proprio cane e per il loro benessere psico-fisico: Rally Obedience, Obedience, Agility Dog, Cani Cross, Maintraling...
- Recupero cani problematici in collaborazioni con canili
- Seminari e stage di cultura cinofila

I nuovi servizi, verranno effettuati grazie anche alla collaborazione di altre figure professionali. Tra i servizi che vorremmo proporre ci saranno:

  • Pensione per cani: in una struttura creata appositamente per il loro benessere e la loro sicurezza, anche per poter ospitare quei cani più difficili da approcciare. La struttura sarà costituita da box con zona giorno e notte, nei quali i cani potranno sostare per riposare e dormire, ma con la possibilità di giardini recintati dove poter correre, giocare e socializzare sempre sotto la super visione di un esperto. I box saranno costruiti con materiali all’avanguardia per poter avere, di per sé, una buona barriera isolante sia per il freddo che per il caldo. Saranno dotati di webcam, per videosorveglianza, ma anche per poter dare la possibilità al proprietario di osservare il proprio cane. Nella decorazione della struttura abbiamo scelto un approccio basato sulla cromoterapia, proprio per rendere l’ambiente ancora più propenso ad un sano relax. Dotata di impianto di filodiffusione per musicoterapia per ridurre i livelli di ansia e di stress per cani che non sono abituati ad essere lontani dalla famiglia, con i quali al bisogno si utilizzeranno anche sistemi di vaporizzazione di oli essenziale per aromaterapia. I box sono immersi nel verde, e la loro pulizia e sanificazione sarà effettuata utilizzando prodotti eco sostenibili.
  • Piscina per cani estiva: una piscina per cani all’aperto da poter utilizzare sia a scopo ludico con il proprio referente umano, oppure a scopo idroterapico per recupero motorio e/o mantenimento muscolare con un esperto del settore.
  • Locale con vasche per la riabilitazione e per il potenziamento muscolare: vasche con acqua per riabilitazione post operatoria o in casa di patologie e/o per lavorare su un mantenimento muscolare, sempre con un esperto del settore.
  • Centro di Educazione Cinofila: la struttura è dotata di due campi per l’educazione cinofila e di gruppo. Il nostro metodo di addestramento si basa esclusivamente sul rinforzo positivo e non utilizza alcun metodo coercitivo.
  • Ambulatori olistici: Poli ambulatori per le medicine definite “complementari”. Con la presenza di medici veterinari e altri esperti del settore, che operano in agopuntura, osteopatia, chiropratica, floriterapia, nutrizione, omeopatia e molte altre discipline della naturopatia.
  • Toelettatura: toelettatura per cani e gatti con l’utilizzo di saponi bio e ecosostenibili. Vasche per l’ozonoterapia con l’utilizzo dell’aromaterapia per bagni che siano un totale relax.
  • Bar per cani e umani: sala relax per chi deve attendere il suo turno per un servizio. Ovviamente con prodotti bio!! 

Cosa ci occorre e cosa ottieni?

Per la realizzazione del progetto procederemo a step. Il primo step sarà realizzare tutta la recinzione perimetrale, i recinti dove verrà effettuata l’educazione del cane, la struttura della pensione per cani e la piscina. 

I 15.000 Euro raccolti da questa campagna di crowdfunding contribuiranno a coprire i costi del verde: in tutto il terreno verranno piantate piante, siepi, arbusti, prato e fiori. Abbiamo constatato che sia possibile piantare sui 180 alberi autoctoni.

Quindi con la tua donazione, oltre che ad aiutarci, contribuirai a rendere più verde la nostra struttura (e il pianeta!) - Crescendo, l’albero assorbirà CO2, proteggerà il suolo e la biodiversità!

Cosa avrai in cambio?

Con la tua donazione riceverai un buono sconto o un pass per i nostri servizi! (Se non sei della zona, abbiamo anche molti servizi online da offrirvi!)

Altrimenti se non vuoi usufruire dei servizi puoi solo donare facendo un'offerta libera!

Per ringraziarti useremo i social network più comuni, ma daremo ad una pianta anche il tuo nome!!!

Altri modi in cui ci puoi aiutare?

Vuoi sostenerci in più di un modo? Aiutaci a spargere la voce e condividi il link alla nostra pagina della campagna con i tuoi contatti - via e-mail, Facebook e Instagram. Puoi usare gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo sopra! Spargi la voce ai tuoi amici, familiari e piattaforme di social media! Più persone sentiranno parlare di noi, maggiori possibilità avremo di raccogliere i nostri fondi.

COME FARE PER INVIARCI DEI SOLDI?

Puoi:

- Scegliere una quota con un servizio associato cliccando sopra le immagini e scegliendo quello che più vi interessa.

- Scegliere una quota chiamata "GRAZIE!" di 10 o 25 euro, nel quale non è associato nessun servizio

- Effettuare un'adozione libera della cifra che vuoi: 

  • Da cellulare scorrendo tutte i riquadri dei servizi, in fondo troverete "MAKE A CONTRIBUTION" e puoi inserire la cifra che vuoi
  • Da PC: Cliccare nel tasto BACK IT (si trova sotto la barra della cifra raggiunta - affianco all'immagine principale) e scegliere poi la cifra da inserire

Poi non resta che cliccare continua e immettere i dati della vostra carta! E' un gioco da ragazzi!!

HELP US TO ACHIEVE OUR DREAM:

A MULTIPURPOSE HOLISTIC DOG CENTRE!

We will be the first multipurpose Dog Centre in Italy based on the importance of the environment,on organic produce and holistic therapy.

Why believe in our project?

In recent years we have become aware of an exponential  increase in interest   in an organic way of life, a greater sensitivity regarding healthier, eco- and cruelty- free products. Many people have moved towards these products because they are better for our health and our well-being and also because we have bcome more aware of our environment. A product without chemical additives, antibiotics, toxic metals, and one which helps the environment is no small thing! This interest obviously is also centred on the well-being of our four-footed friends, who are a part of our family. Millions of families around the world have a pet, and also a considerable interest in their well-being and health. Because of this our company aims to provide services with minimal environmental impact, and with a holistic approach while caring for these animals. The word “Holistic “comes from the Greek word “HOLOS”, meaning “the whole, global”. This definition encompasses all the numerous aspects and factors which affect health and well-being-in this case our animal friends. We take into consideration the context in which they live, their food, habits, psychophysical equilibrium, their ability to manage emotional  stress and their relationships with humans or other animals. We work on prevention,  on balance both in body and mind,in emotion and energy.

Which services will our company supply?

We need to enlarge our facility to set up new services for animal well-being. We have already started some services, which are known and recognized locally:

-One-to-one and group courses  (dog handling at home and in the urban environment) basic and advanced training, courses for correct socializing, for well-informed adoption awareness, courses for new mums and pregnant mums, group walking.

-Dog sporting activities, to reinforce the relationship between dog and owner and for  psychophysical well-being : Rally Obedience, Obedience, Dog Agility, Treibball, Dog Cross Country and Maintrailing.

-Rehabilitation of difficult dogs in collaboration with dog shelters and kennels

-Dog seminars and traineeships

Funny Dog has decided to increase its services, thanks also to the help of other professionals.

We should like to include the following:

-Dog boarding kennels: a facility specially created for their well-being and safety, and also to accommodate dogs  who are more difficult to approach. The facility will comprise day and night time quarters, where the dogs can rest and sleep,but also the possibiliy of fenced gardens, where they can run, play and socialize with other dogs under the strict supervision of an expert. The kennels will be constructed with state of the art materials which have an insulating barrier for both heat and cold. They will be equipped with a webcam with CCTV for safety, but also to enable the owner to see his or her dog.  We used a chromotherapy based approach when decorating the kennels to make the environment more relaxing. We have installed pipelines for music therapy to reduce anxiety and stress levels for dogs who are not used to being away from home. If needs be these can also be used as vaporising systems with essential oils for aromatherapy. The kennels are surrounded by nature, and are cleaned and sanitized using eco-friendly products.

-Summer swimming pool for dogs: an outdoor swimming pool for recreational purposes with a  trainer, or for hydrotherapeutic purposes such as motor recovery or muscle maintenance with an expert in the field.

-Room with rehabilitaion tubs for muscle building:water tubs for post-surgery rehabilitation, for specific pathologies or for muscle maintence, with an expert in the field.

Dog Training Centre: There are two fields for individual and group dog training. Our training method is based exclusively on positive reinforcement and never uses a coercive approach.

Holistic clinics: Polyclinics for “complementary” medicine. With vets and other experts in the field, who work with acupuncture, osteopathy, chiropractice, flower therapy, nutrition, homeopathy and other natural therapies.

Grooming: dog and cat grooming using eco friendly soaps. Ozone therapy baths  with aromatherapy for total relax.

 

What  we need and what you’ll get!

We will implement the project in steps. Our first task is to fence off the whole perimeter and all the fenced areas where the dogs will be trained, the structure for the kennels and the pool-so that we can enjoy spring and summer right away!

The €10,000 raised by our crowdfunding scheme will go towards the costs for green areas: bushes, trees, meadow and flowers will be planted. We have found that there is sufficient space for about 180 native trees.

With your donation you will help make our facility (and the planet!) greener-as the trees grow, they will absorb more CO2, and protect the soil and its biodiversity

 

What will you have in return?

By adopting us you will have a discount voucher or a pass for our services! (If you don’t live locally, we can offer you lots of other services online)

To thank you we shall use the usual social networks, but also give a plant your name!!

Other ways you can help us.

Would you like to support us in other ways? Help spread the word and share the link to our campaign page with your contacts on email, Facebook and Instagram. You can use the Indiegogo share tools above!Tell your friends, family and social media platforms!The more people hear word about us the greater our possibility  of fundraising.

Da cellulare scorrendo tutte i riquadri dei servizi, in fondo troverete "MAKE A CONTRIBUTION" e puoi inserire la cifra che vuoi
Da PC: Cliccare nel tasto BACK IT (si trova sotto la barra della cifra raggiunta - affianco all'immagine principale) e scegliere poi la cifra da inserire

Poi non resta che cliccare continua e immettere i dati della vostra carta! E' un gioco da ragazzi!!

HELP US TO ACHIEVE OUR DREAM:
A MULTIPURPOSE HOLISTIC DOG CENTRE!
We will be the first multipurpose Dog Centre in Italy based on the importance of the environment,on organic produce and holistic therapy.
Why believe in our project?
In recent years we have become aware of an exponential  increase in interest   in an organic way of life, a greater sensitivity regarding healthier, eco- and cruelty- free products. Many people have moved towards these products because they are better for our health and our well-being and also because we have bcome more aware of our environment. A product without chemical additives, antibiotics, toxic metals, and one which helps the environment is no small thing! This interest obviously is also centred on the well-being of our four-footed friends, who are a part of our family. Millions of families around the world have a pet, and also a considerable interest in their well-being and health. Because of this our company aims to provide services with minimal environmental impact, and with a holistic approach while caring for these animals. The word “Holistic “comes from the Greek word “HOLOS”, meaning “the whole, global”. This definition encompasses all the numerous aspects and factors which affect health and well-being-in this case our animal friends. We take into consideration the context in which they live, their food, habits, psychophysical equilibrium, their ability to manage emotional  stress and their relationships with humans or other animals. We work on prevention,  on balance both in body and mind,in emotion and energy.
Which services will our company supply?
We need to enlarge our facility to set up new services for animal well-being. We have already started some services, which are known and recognized locally:
-One-to-one and group courses  (dog handling at home and in the urban environment) basic and advanced training, courses for correct socializing, for well-informed adoption awareness, courses for new mums and pregnant mums, group walking.
-Dog sporting activities, to reinforce the relationship between dog and owner and for  psychophysical well-being : Rally Obedience, Obedience, Dog Agility, Treibball, Dog Cross Country and Maintrailing.
-Rehabilitation of difficult dogs in collaboration with dog shelters and kennels
-Dog seminars and traineeships
Funny Dog has decided to increase its services, thanks also to the help of other professionals.
We should like to include the following:
-Dog boarding kennels: a facility specially created for their well-being and safety, and also to accommodate dogs  who are more difficult to approach. The facility will comprise day and night time quarters, where the dogs can rest and sleep,but also the possibiliy of fenced gardens, where they can run, play and socialize with other dogs under the strict supervision of an expert. The kennels will be constructed with state of the art materials which have an insulating barrier for both heat and cold. They will be equipped with a webcam with CCTV for safety, but also to enable the owner to see his or her dog.  We used a chromotherapy based approach when decorating the kennels to make the environment more relaxing. We have installed pipelines for music therapy to reduce anxiety and stress levels for dogs who are not used to being away from home. If needs be these can also be used as vaporising systems with essential oils for aromatherapy. The kennels are surrounded by nature, and are cleaned and sanitized using eco-friendly products.
-Summer swimming pool for dogs: an outdoor swimming pool for recreational purposes with a  trainer, or for hydrotherapeutic purposes such as motor recovery or muscle maintenance with an expert in the field.
-Room with rehabilitaion tubs for muscle building:water tubs for post-surgery rehabilitation, for specific pathologies or for muscle maintence, with an expert in the field.
Dog Training Centre: There are two fields for individual and group dog training. Our training method is based exclusively on positive reinforcement and never uses a coercive approach.
Holistic clinics: Polyclinics for “complementary” medicine. With vets and other experts in the field, who work with acupuncture, osteopathy, chiropractice, flower therapy, nutrition, homeopathy and other natural therapies.
Grooming: dog and cat grooming using eco friendly soaps. Ozone therapy baths  with aromatherapy for total relax.
 
What  we need and what you’ll get!
We will implement the project in steps. Our first task is to fence off the whole perimeter and all the fenced areas where the dogs will be trained, the structure for the kennels and the pool-so that we can enjoy spring and summer right away!
The €10,000 raised by our crowdfunding scheme will go towards the costs for green areas: bushes, trees, meadow and flowers will be planted. We have found that there is sufficient space for about 180 native trees.
With your donation you will help make our facility (and the planet!) greener-as the trees grow, they will absorb more CO2, and protect the soil and its biodiversity
 
What will you have in return?
By adopting us you will have a discount voucher or a pass for our services! (If you don’t live locally, we can offer you lots of other services online)
To thank you we shall use the usual social networks, but also give a plant your name!!
Other ways you can help us.
Would you like to support us in other ways? Help spread the word and share the link to our campaign page with your contacts on email, Facebook and Instagram. You can use the Indiegogo share tools above!Tell your friends, family and social media platforms!The more people hear word about us the greater our possibility  of fundraising.

story:
A Little Bit About Us

My name is McKenzie Crawford and I am the owner of Books and Bakery LLC. I was born and raised in Carroll, Iowa. The town is near and dear to my heart. It is where I knew I wanted to start my future business, where I wanted to buy my first home, and where I wanted to start my family. I am now grown up and am living those dreams. My fiancé and I bought our first home in Carroll, September of 2019. We are raising our two wonderful, little boys in our family home. I feel incredibly blessed to be able to live and work in this community.

When I was a little girl, I often dreamt of one day running a bookstore. As I grew, that dream expanded, warped, and altered. As a teenager, I went vegan and my bookstore dream turned into wanting to run a bookstore and café or bakery combination. I was often told to get my head out of the clouds, as that dream is too far fetched. However, here we are. Making my dreams a reality and bringing bookstore magic to Carroll areas and beyond. Our online store has been busy and shipping orders all around the United States. We are ready for our next adventure as a new bookstore (one day bakery as well) in downtown Carroll, Iowa.

My brother, Alex, has been my best friend since we were little kids. Alex is autistic and happens to be non verbal as well. He graduated high school this year and was ready for his next adventure! Alex wanted to get right to work after graduation, so he attempted to join a local program that assists those with disabilities in a work place environment. While sitting on a waitlist for said program, Alex and I continued to work closely together. With the help of my wonderful younger brother, this one woman operation turned into a lovely family business. Alex works hard to ensure our new business is always accommodating for those who need extra supports and assistance. With that, his goals and dreams had also warped, changed, and grew.

With help from you, our dreams and goals can continue to grow and help us spread happiness and magic through the world of books.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are working to raise $12,000 to get us into a retail location. This money will go directly into our first month's rent, installing new hard wood flooring, buying sturdy, hardwood shelves that will last many years (and hopefully a couple of moves), paint, tables and fixtures, signage, and a brand new point of sale system. After all alterations and updates, the rest of our money will go towards a variety of book and sideline inventory. 

The store will need some loving and TLC. Alex and I are ready to put in the love, soul and work to our storefront. We need your help to fund a lot of that love and soul.  

With your contribution, you will receive perks including (but not limited to) exclusive Books and Bakery merchandise, a personalized thank you sent from Alex and I, exclusive invitation to our pre-grand opening launch party, plaques within the store with your names and/or company printed proudly for future customers to see. 

Our goal is most definitely flexible. What happens if we don't reach it in full? The money donated will go into the storefront, however not to the extent we have in our plans. All perks will still be received by our contributors. If we raise more than our goal, all excess will go towards more extensive inventory for the shop and our marketing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we completely understand. Times can be hard. Want to help us grow, but can't afford to contribute right now? Do us a favor and share our crowdfunding link to your social medias and share with your friends. You can spread the word by following us on social media and sharing our posts about fundraising updates.

We are still accepting used book donations, so if you have any books you would like to part with, we would love to add them to our shelves. Check out our website to see donation requirements, or message us on social media.

We appreciate everyone who wants to help and we will love anything you can do to help. Thank you for being here.

 

Let's make magic happen.
